Call For Papers: b'\nThe CODAI workshop coalesces the emerging energy in the AI compiler communities and AI accelerator communities focusing on Edge AI in both academic and industrial research. Original technical research submissions as well as submissions from industry and applications on, but not limited to, the following topics are invited:\r \xe2\x97\x8f Optimization techniques of neural networks on embedded edge systems: compression, pruning,\rquantization techniques, hardware/compiler-aware neural architecture search, etc.\r\xe2\x97\x8f Performance estimation of neural networks on embedded systems: virtual prototyping,\rsurrogate modeling, profiling etc.\r\xe2\x97\x8f Compilers for Edge AI: partitioning, mapping, retargeting, intermediate representations, for\rheterogeneous systems and architectures, \xce\xbcC, DSP etc.\r\xe2\x97\x8f Code-generation and compiler-backends for AI accelerators - especially for RISC-V and\rbeyond-von-Neumann AI accelerators is appreciated\r\xe2\x97\x8f Applications: processing of embedded vision, sensor signal processing, novel brain-inspired algorithms for Edge AI etc.\r \n'

title: b'Mindtrek 2022'
description: b'25th International Academic Mindtrek Conference'
Categories: b'human computer interaction' b'technology' b'pervasive computing' b'games'
Call For Papers: b"\nWe are very pleased to announce that the 25th International Academic Mindtrek conference will take place between the 16th and 18th of November 2022. We are hoping to host a hybrid event in Tampere, Finland with professional video streaming.  \r The conference will welcome proposals for full papers, workshops, demonstrations and poster presentations on a variety of topics (see tracks below) as well as a Doctoral Consortium. \r The International Academic Mindtrek has been for several years an exciting meeting place where researchers, experts and thinkers present results from their latest works regarding the development of novel technology, media and digital culture for the society of tomorrow. \r Mindtrek brings together people not only from various fields and domains but also from different sectors: from companies, startups, academia and various governmental institutions. This makes Mindtrek the perfect opportunity for advancing research results towards practical utilization by the industry, as well as getting out-of-the-box research ideas based on interaction with practitioners. \r Academic Mindtrek 2022 welcomes all scientific contributions that present relevant and actual studies of today that may shape the way we interact with the technologies of tomorrow. Our goal is to facilitate meaningful experiences and knowledge sharing on how technology merges into society and what opportunities and hidden threats it brings to it. \r The conference is grounded in a strong collaboration between local organizers from Tampere University and prestigious international partners. This collaboration focuses Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) research and development and in particular around several key areas, organized in the conference as specific Tracks.  \r Academic Mindtrek 2022 welcomes submissions under the following tracks:\r      1. Games and Gamification\r       Chairs: Juho Hamari and Benedikt Morschheuser (FAU Erlangen-N\xc3\xbcrnberg)\r      2. Understanding and Designing the Socio-Technical\r       Chairs: Thomas Ollson and Robb Mitchell (University of Southern Denmark).\r      3. Fictional, Speculative and Critical Futures\r       Chairs: O\xc4\x9fuz 'Oz' Buruk, Ahmet B\xc3\xb6r\xc3\xbctecene (Link\xc3\xb6ping University),Conor Linehan(University College Cork) \r      4. Playable Cities\r       Chairs: Mattia Thibault, Anton Nijholt (Twente University)and Annika Wolff (LUT University) \r      5. Metaverse\r       Chairs: Nannan Xi, FIona Nah (City University of Hong Kong), Philipp A. Rauschnabel (Universit\xc3\xa4t der Bundeswehr M\xc3\xbcnchen) and Sylvia Xueni Pan(Goldsmiths, University of London). \r      6. Human-nature interaction\r       Chairs: Ferran Altarriba , Velvet Spors, Katherine Isbister(University of California, Santa Cruz) and Pat Brundell(University of Nottingham). \r      7. Datafication for Good\r       Chairs: Zampeta Legaki, Kostas Karpouzis(Panteion University of Social and Political Sciences) \r      8. Dark Side of Information Technology Use\r       Chairs: Henri Pirkkalainen, Monideepa Tarafdar, (Lancaster University) and Markus Salo (University of Jyv\xc3\xa4skyl\xc3\xa4). \r      9. Robotic and conversational interactions \r       Chairs: Aino Ahtinen, Mohammad Obaid (Chalmers University of Technology), Roel Pieters and Nasim Beheshtian. \r      10. Designing for and with Children \r        Chairs: Sumita Sharma, Grace Eden (Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology) and Noura Howell (GeorgiaTech) \r      11. Technology in Education\r        Chairs: Muhterem Dindar and Daniel Bodemer (University of Duisburg-Essen) \r      12: Accessibility\r        Chairs: TBA \r          More information on each track can be found at:\r        https://www.mindtrek.org/2022/academic-mindtrek-tracks/\r In addition to these tracks, the general track, welcomes submissions that share methodological understanding and practices on how to design, develop, implement and evaluate interactive computing systems and services for human use. The submitted papers should be focusing on phenomena related to Human-Computer Interaction (HCI): human factors and requirements, usability and ergonomics, privacy, ethics and trustworthiness of technologies as well as the exploration of other factors involved (e.g., sociological and psychological factors). \n\t"

title: b'DFT 2022'
description: b'Evolution of Web Driven Data Fabric Technology'
Categories: b'data fabric architecture' b'scalable data fabric' b'enterprise data fabric' b'big data fabric'
Call For Papers: b'\nCall for Book Chapters by DeGruyter (Scopus Indexed)\r Chapter 1 titled \xe2\x80\x9cConvergence of Modern Technologies for Data Architecture \xe2\x80\x9cwill discuss the convergence strategies of Edge Computing, Cloud Computing and IoT.  \r Chapter 2 titled \xe2\x80\x9cWeb Driven Data Operations for Industry 4.0\xe2\x80\x9d will describe the quick business solutions and management strategies for Scalable and Web Driven Data Fabric Applications.\r Chapter 3 titled \xe2\x80\x9cIdentifying Popular trends in the Data Driven World\xe2\x80\x9d surveys popular Data Fabrication Strategies for the Systematic Market Research and Getting Right Product-Policy Mix. \r Chapter 4 titled \xe2\x80\x9cHarvesting and Visualization of Big Data Fabric\xe2\x80\x9d will provide the walkthrough for various Big Data Visualization Tools apart from Power BI and Tableau. A case study of IBM Cloud Pak will be discussed.\r Chapter 5 titled \xe2\x80\x9cData Fabric Use Cases\xe2\x80\x9d will lay emphasis on sustainable development and standardizing the circular economy for Green Cloud Computing Practices.\r Chapter 6 includes \xe2\x80\x9cData Fabric Technologies, and its Innovative Applications\xe2\x80\x9d in Education Sector, IIoT, Health Domain and Logistics, Disaster Management and Public Information Dissemination Strategies.\r Chapter 7 titled\xe2\x80\x9d Enterprise Data\xe2\x80\x9d includes discussion on Enterprise Information Systems, Enterprise Data Governance, Enterprise Data Fabric Architecture, its related preservation and privacy policies.  \r Chapter 8 titled \xe2\x80\x9cRest API for Web Driven Data Fabric\xe2\x80\x9d focusses on the useful Rest API for meaningful data exchange over Internet.\r Chapter 9 discusses \xe2\x80\x9cFeatures, Key Challenges and Applications of Open-Source Data Fabric Platforms\xe2\x80\x9d that is reproducible, verifiable and Autonomous.\r Chapter 10 titled \xe2\x80\x9cSimulation tools for Big Data Fabric\xe2\x80\x9d demonstrates the working of most popular simulation tools for Big Data Modelling.\r Chapter 11 titled \xe2\x80\x9cSecurity, Privacy and Authentication Framework for\rWeb Driven Data Fabric\xe2\x80\x9d provides details about the Trust Management Policies, Framework for mitigating Trust Issues in Data Fabric.\r Chapter 12 titled \xe2\x80\x9cGovernment Compliance Strategies for Web Driven Data\rFabric\xe2\x80\x9d provides study of Hyperledger fabric and its performance analysis for Blockchain Network in Framing Government Policies.\r\n'

title: b'OPODIS 2022'
description: b'26th Conference on Principles of Distributed Systems'
Categories: b'distributed systems' b'theory' b'distributed computing' b'systems'
Call For Papers: b'\n============================\rOPODIS 2022: Call for Papers\r============================\r 26th Conference on Principles of Distributed Systems\rBrussels, Belgium\r13-15 December 2022\r https://sites.uclouvain.be/OPODIS2022/\r OPODIS is an open forum for the exchange of state-of-the-art knowledge on distributed computing and distributed computer systems. OPODIS aims at having a balanced program that combines theory and practice of distributed systems. OPODIS solicits papers in all aspects of distributed systems, including theory, specification, design, system building, and performance.\r Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r - Distributed systems, theory and practice: fault-tolerance and consistency, impossibility results in distributed computing\r- Blockchain theory and practice\r- Cloud and datacenters: Cloud, grid, edge computing, IoT, data centers\r- Communication and mobile networks\t\r- Parallelism, concurrency, and multicore systems\r- Shared and transactional memory, memory management\t\r- Dependable systems, system security\t\r- Distributed graph algorithms\t\r- Middleware and Operating systems\t\r- File and storage systems: distributed storage, file systems and database systems\r- Distributed ML: distributed recommender systems, systems for machine learning\r- Distributed data analytics: big data analytics frameworks, data-intensive computing\r- Mobile agents and robots\t\r- Self-stabilizing, self-organizing, and autonomous systems\t\r- Game theory in distributed computing\r **** Important Dates ****\r - Abstract registration: August 26, 2022\r- Submission deadline: September 2, 2022\r- Acceptance notification: October 21, 2022\r- Final version due: November 11, 2022\r- Conference: December 13-15, 2022\r **** Organization ****\r - General chair: \r    Etienne Riviere (UCLouvain)\r - PC chairs:\r    Eshcar Hillel (PLIOPS, Israel)\r    Roberto Palmieri (Lehigh University, USA)\r The program committee will be listed on the conference webpage.\r **** Venue ****\r The conference will be held in Brussels, Belgium. It will be hosted by UCLouvain on its Brussels campus, with a direct public transport connection to the city center.\r Physical attendance to the conference is strongly encouraged, but the conference will offer a hybrid participation option for participants unable to do otherwise. At least one full registration will be required per accepted paper, regardless of the mode of participation.\r **** Double-blind review ****\r We will use double-blind peer review. All submissions must be anonymous. We will use a somewhat relaxed implementation of double-blind peer review: you are free to disseminate your work through arXiv and other online repositories and give presentations on your work as usual. However, please make sure you do not mention your own name or affiliation in the submission, and please do not include obvious references that reveal your identity. A reviewer who has not previously seen the paper should be able to read it without accidentally learning the identity of the authors. Please feel free to ask the PC chairs if you have any questions about the double-blind policy of OPODIS 2022.\r **** Submissions ****\r - Papers are to be submitted electronically through HotCRP at the following link: https://hotcrp.info.ucl.ac.be/opodis2022/.\r- Submissions must be in English, in pdf format.\r- Submissions must be prepared using the LaTeX style templates for LIPIcs, choosing the A4 paper option.\r- Length: a submission must not exceed 15 pages, including everything but references. Unlimited pages are allowed for references.\r- Cover page: the first page of the submission should be a separate cover page, including only the following information:\r-- The title of the paper,\r-- A list of keywords,\r-- An abstract of 1 to 2 paragraphs summarizing the contributions of the submission,\r-- Whether or not the paper is eligible for the best student paper award.\r- Appendix: the submission may contain a clearly-marked appendix, which will be read at the discretion of the reviewers. If desired, the appendix can be a copy of the full paper.\r The submission must contain a clear presentation of the merits of the paper, including discussion of its importance, prior work, and an outline of key technical ideas and methods used to achieve the main claims. All of the ideas necessary for an expert to fully verify the central claims in the submission, including experimental results, should be included in the submission. \r A submission must report on original research that has not previously appeared in a journal or conference with published proceedings. It should not be concurrently submitted to such a journal or conference. Any overlap with a published or concurrently submitted paper must be clearly indicated. The Program Chairs reserve the right to reject submissions that are out of scope, of clearly inferior quality, or that violate the submission guidelines. Each of the remaining papers will undergo a thorough reviewing process.\r **** Publication ****\r OPODIS has post-proceedings published by Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs) in gold open access model. The proceedings become available online, free of charge, after the conference. Preliminary versions of the proceedings will be available to participants at the conference electronically. The camera-ready version of a paper must have the same format and be of the same length as its submitted version.\r **** Contact ****\r https://sites.uclouvain.be/OPODIS2022/\ropodis-2022@uclouvain.be\r\n'

b'

13th International Conference on Computer Science, Engineering and Applications (CCSEA 2023)

March 18 ~ 19, 2023, Vienna, Austria

Due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, registered authors are now able to present their work through our online platforms.

Scope & Topics

13th International Conference on Computer Science, Engineering and Applications (CCSEA 2023)will provide an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology and applications of Computer Science and Information Technology. The Conference looks for significant contributions to all major fields of the Computer Science and Information Technology in theoretical and practical aspects. The aim of the conference is to provide a platform to the researchers and practitioners from both academia as well as industry to meet and share cutting-edge development in the field.

Authors are solicited to contribute to the conference by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the areas of Computer Science, Engineering and Applications.

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following

  • Algorithms and Bioinformatics\r
  • Computer Architecture and Real Time Systems\r
  • Database and Data Mining\r
  • Dependable, Reliable and Autonomic Computing\r
  • DSP/Image Processing/Pattern Recognition/Multimedia\r
  • Embedded System and Software\r
  • Game and Software Engineering\r
  • Geographical Information Systems/ Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GIS/GNSS)\r
  • Grid and Scalable Computing\r
  • Intelligent Information & Database systems\r
  • IT policy and Business management\r
  • Mobile and Ubiquitous computing\r
  • Modeling and Simulation\r
  • Multimedia Systems and Services\r
  • Networking and Communications\r
  • Performance Evaluation\r
  • Programming Languages\r
  • Security and Information Assurance\r
  • Soft Computing (AI, Neural Networks, Fuzzy Systems, etc.)\r
  • Software Engineering\r
  • Web and Internet computing\r
  • Theoretical Computer Science\r
  • Natural Language Processing\r
  • Operating Systems\r
  • Compiler Design\r
  • Computer Education

Paper Submission

Authors are invited to submit papers through the conference Submission System by October 20, 2022 . Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this conference. The proceedings of the conference will be published by Computer Science Conference Proceedings in Computer Science & Information Technology (CS & IT) series (Confirmed).

Selected papers from CCSEA 2023, after further revisions, will be published in the special issue of the following journals.

  • International Journal of Computer Science & Information Technology (IJCSIT) - INSPEC, WJCI Indexed
  • Computer Science & Engineering: An International Journal (CSEIJ)
  • International Journal of Computer Science, Engineering and Applications (IJCSEA)- WJCI Indexed
  • International Journal of Computer Science, Engineering and Information Technology (IJCSEIT)
  • Computer Applications: An International Journal (CAIJ)
  • Information Technology in Industry (ITII)

Important Dates

Submission Deadline: October 20, 2022
Authors Notification: December 20, 2022
Final Manuscript Due: December 28, 2022
'

title: b'NIB 2022'
description: b'1st Workshop on New IP and Beyond'
Categories: b'protocols' b'network architecture' b'high-precision communication' b'6G'
Call For Papers: b'\nThere is a need to evolve fixed-network protocols to support 5G, B5G and to complement 6G technological research as the focus on communications shifts from general-purpose to large-scale special-purpose industry verticals, interconnecting different sites, suppliers, and clients. An extremely reliant, intelligent, and lean network will be required to ensure the efficiency of remote operations. It requires tighter integration with machine control applications in the cloud. Protocols for critical infrastructure and preparation for unforeseen events, such as COVID-19, natural disasters, unprecedented surges, and/or security breaches, etc. need to be designed and enhanced.\r We solicit stimulating, original, previously unpublished ideas on completed work, position papers, and/or work-in-progress papers in the form of extended abstracts. We invite submissions of concepts, designs, frameworks, and experiments on a wide range of topics of interest, including, but not limited to:\r - Semantic addressing and routing\r- High Precision Communications\r- Qualitative and/or Semantic Communications\r- Integration of Spatial and Terrestrial Networks\r- Energy Reduction in New IP\r- New Technologies for Networks in the Year 2030 and Beyond\r- Protocol and verification methods for disseminating KPIs for High Precision Communications.\r- Foundational theory, algorithms, and principles in the design of protocols in large-scale multistakeholder network architectures.\r- Theory and algorithms for lossless networking and lossless packet delivery\r- Resource efficiency and usage mechanisms for deterministic, reliable, and lossless data transmission\r- Privacy-preserving approaches\r- Monetization and Business models to be used by service providers\r\n'

title: b'MLMHCIHCAMCI 2022'
description: b'Machine Learning Methods in High-Content Imaging and High-Content Analysis for Molecular and Cellular Imaging'
Categories: b'molecular imaging' b'cellular image analysis' b'machine learning' b'high-content analysis'
Call For Papers: b'\nHigh-content imaging (HCI) and high-content analysis (HCA) provide flexible scalability to molecular and cellular research. Particularly, HCA is a method that is used in biological research and drug discovery to identify substances such as small molecules, peptides, or RNAi that alter the phenotype of a cell in a desired manner. Both HCI and HCA feature modules to tackle the specific research including objectives, filters, imaging modes, environmental conditions, etc. Due to the revolution limit, more influential tools are desired for cellular and molecular imaging. On the other hand, the imaging systems are to be supported by modern software tools (including the machine learning tools) with modularity to handle HCIs and HCAs that are characterized by tremendous molecular data.\r The living cell images along with software modules for HCA provide a quantum of cellular assays. These cellular assays increase the HCI\xe2\x80\x99s throughput and enable medical experts to reach new medical findings and conclusions. The advent of novel machine learning (ML) tools and algorithms enables the user to analyse a large volume of data and perform HCA. Successful applications include analysis of stimulated trans-fluor cells, BPAE cells and mitochondria cells, neurite outgrowth segmentation, spheroid segmentation, granular object detection, nuclear puncta cell mask, heterogeneous cell population, focal-adhesion segmentation, cell cycle measuring, neuron detection, etc. Machine learning (ML) is a multi-disciplinary and interdisciplinary science, which uses computers as tools and is committed to simulating human learning methods in real-time. Recently, ML has achieved great success in cellular/molecular analysis.\r This topic aims to report the recent advances in machine learning-guided HCI and HCA for molecular and cellular imaging addressing, but not limited to, the following themes:\r \xe2\x80\xa2 HCI systems\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Machine learning-related techniques in HCA\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Modularity in cellular/molecular imaging modes\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Statistical tools and data analytics in cellular/molecular imaging\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Prediction and classification algorithms for cellular/molecular imaging data\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Clinical diagnosis and treatment\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Neurite outgrowth segmentation\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Cell cycle measuring\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Exploration of cancer immunotherapy targets\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Cell metabolic analysis\r \n'

b'

title: b'V-Cybercult 2022'
description: b'Visuality and Cyberculture International Conference'
Categories: b'digital humanities' b'arts' b'visual communication' b'network theory'
Call For Papers: b"\nVisuality and Cyberculture International Conference\r The Institute for Multidisciplinary Research in Art (ICMA) and the Faculty of Visual Arts and Design at George Enescu National University of the Arts (UNAGE) are pleased to invite submissions of abstracts, panel proposals, and artistic research contributions for the Visuality and Cyberculture International Conference. The theme of the V-Cybercult 2022 conference is Beyond Biopolitics: Visual Digital Culture and the 21st Century Disruptive Events.\rThe Russian invasion of Ukraine flooded traditional and digital media with static and moving images including newsreels, amateur, and drone footage, or satellite imagery displaying military force abuse, violence against civilians, shelling, damaged and destroyed buildings, and people leaving their homes and country in what was described as the largest exodus since WW2. While social media was banned in Russia and started, in return, to track and control information related to war all over the world, fake news and image manipulation reached maximum levels and seem to be a novelty in re-creating an old-World War discourse within the EU.\rHowever, such imagery of socially and politically disruptive events, following the paths of globalization, was already present in the contemporary visual culture for the last two decades. Attempts to manipulate, control, divert and even capitalize such visual data were an integral part of contemporary crisis management of military conflicts and health emergencies taking place in other parts of the world beyond Europe. The conjunction of bio-, necro-, and psychopolitics, on the one hand, and digitally produced and circulated images associated with socially and politically disruptive events, on the other hand, raises several questions such as: What are the main differences between the reproduction and production of these events in the digital media realm? What is their social impact? How did the digital productions articulate and/or calibrate the political and traditional media discourses? What trends and digital policies can be linked to the control and dissemination of imagery through social networks? What are the main differences between war, pandemic, and other forms of social unrest? How did digitality mediate the COVID-19 pandemic discourse and influence the netizens? How did the latter's activity contribute to the spread of panic and the creation of an infodemic and, eventually, a climate of fear? Soon after, how has digitality changed the way the world perceived the Russian-Ukrainian conflict? How are the EU and US\xe2\x80\x99s geopolitical implications and power relations reflected in the digital mediascape? At the same time, what role do digitally co-produced images such as memes play in the dissemination, circulation, and criticism of information? What types of civic and political resistance were or can still be imagined by artists and netizens alike?\rBeyond Biopolitics: Visual Digital Culture and the 21st Century Disruptive Events encourages engagement with a wide range of topics, which we hope will attract researchers interested in the Y2K problem, 9/11, the Global Financial Crisis, the Boko Haram insurgency, the Mexican drug war, the Syrian Civil War, the Yemeni Crisis, the Tigray War, the COVID-19 pandemic, and the Russo-Ukrainian War in terms of power relations, visual politics, political aesthetics, information politics, biocommunicability,  activist media, network society and the state of emergency, social distancing or memetic warfare. Hence, proposals might address the various social, political, economic, artistic, individual, collective, institutional, representational, and technological dimensions of digital interactions and environments. As mentioned, potential topics include, but are not limited to:\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tBio-, necro- and psychopower in the information age.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tBiopolitical aesthetics.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tBiocommunicability and the public sphere.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tInformation biopolitics and network society.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tDisruptive events in a global age: digital media and reporting conflict.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tElectronic/platform colonialism.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tNetwork attention.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tDigital citizens and revolutions.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tParticipatory culture and memetic warfare.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tNetnography and cyberethics.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tPost-literate society.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tTechnocriticism.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tTechnorealism.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tPlatform capitalism and social media ideologies.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCancel culture.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tPost-truth politics.\r Keynote speakers:\rMark DEUZE \xe2\x80\x93 Professor of Journalism and Media Culture at the University of Amsterdam.\rJan VAN DIJK \xe2\x80\x93 Professor of Communication Science and the Sociology of the Information Society at the University of Twente.\rPayal Arora - Professor of Technology, Values, and Global Media Cultures at Erasmus University Rotterdam.\rRyan M. MILNER \xe2\x80\x93 Associate Professor of Modern Media Technology and Digital Communications at the College of Charleston.\r Submission:\r\xef\x83\x98\tIndividual proposal \xe2\x80\x93 The abstracts of the communications (maximum 250 words) must be accompanied by 5 keywords, 3 bibliographical references and a biographical note of the author (maximum 200 words).\r\xef\x83\x98\tPanel proposals should include a short description and rationale (200 words) together with abstracts for each of the 3-4 papers (150-200 words each including 5 keywords, 3 bibliographical references and details of the contributor), and the name and contact details of the panel proposer. The panel proposer should coordinate the submissions for that panel as a single proposal.\r\xef\x83\x98\tArtistic research \xe2\x80\x93 We actively support the presentation of artistic research related to the conference theme and topics. Abstracts should be up to 200 words with 3-4 screenshots of the artistic work or project and a biographical note.\r\xef\x83\x98\tBook presentations for authors who want to present their recent or on-going projects \xe2\x80\x93 send an abstract of maximum 250 words and a bibliographical note.\r Organizing committee:\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCristian Nae (Director of ICMA and Associate Professor at UNAGE Ia\xc8\x99i)\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tC\xc4\x83t\xc4\x83lin Gheorghe (Associate Professor, UNAGE Ia\xc8\x99i)\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCristina Moraru (Assistant Professor, UNAGE Ia\xc8\x99i)\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tDaniel Ungureanu (Ph.D. Student, UNAGE Ia\xc8\x99i)\r Keynotes:\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tThe conference takes place online.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tThe event\xe2\x80\x99s official language is English.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tSubmission and participation are free of charge.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tAll proposals (abstracts and practice-based work) will be peer-reviewed.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tAbstracts will be submitted in PDF format.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tSubmissions must be original and written in English.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tAll rights of the submission contents are kept by the authors.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tAccepted submissions will be presented at the Conference: 20 min.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tAll questions about submissions should be addressed to the organizing committee at: daniyyelungureanu@gmail.com or https://www.facebook.com/icmaunage.\r Visuality and Cyberculture International Conference organizing committee is aiming to publish an edited collection of papers focusing on the conference theme with a reputable academic publisher. Further details of how to submit will be announced after the conference.\r Important dates\rSubmission deadline: July 31.\rAcceptance notice: August 15.\rOfficial program announcement: September 1.\rConference: November 17-19\r Proposals should be submitted to: https://easychair.org/cfp/V-CYBERCULT-2022 or daniyyelungureanu@gmail.com.\rWebsites: https://www.arteiasi.ro/?page_id=1144\xe2\x9f\xa8=eng, https://icma.arteiasi.ro/.\rFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/icmaunage, https://www.instagram.com/icmaunage/. \r\n"

Call For Papers: b'\nExtended deadline for \rCall for Papers and Workshops\r8th July 2022\r  Conference Ventana 4 has extended the deadline to receive applications for Papers and Workshops. The new date is Friday 8th of July 2022.\r The title of this year\xe2\x80\x99s conference is Decolonial Dialogues from within and beyond the Global Margins, aiming to stablish multilateral conversations through diverse postcolonial and decolonial experiences in and beyond Latin America. Moreover, this year we are including a special branch of the conference dedicated to Africa, hoping to observe, share, and compare experiences between the two continents. \r The topics to be approached include (but are not limited to):\r \xef\x82\xa7\tAfrican studies\r\xef\x82\xa7\tAnthropology\r\xef\x82\xa7\tDecolonial narratives\r\xef\x82\xa7\tFeminism and Gender studies\r\xef\x82\xa7\tSociocultural manifestations and interventions\r\xef\x82\xa7\tArts\r\xef\x82\xa7\tLanguage\r\xef\x82\xa7\tLatin America studies\r\xef\x82\xa7\tLiterature\r\xef\x82\xa7\tPandemic and postpandemic world\r\xef\x82\xa7\tPolitics\r\xef\x82\xa7\tEducation\r\xef\x82\xa7\tBodypolitics\r\xef\x82\xa7\tQueer and LGBT+\r\xef\x82\xa7\tSTEM\r\xef\x82\xa7\tEconomy\r\xef\x82\xa7\tPsychology\r\xef\x82\xa7\tSocial (dis)order\r\xef\x82\xa7\tTrauma\r\xef\x82\xa7\tEtc.\r Applications for papers must consist of a 250-300 words abstract, title, 3-5 keywords, a short biography (100 words) and institutional affiliation.\r Applications for workshops must include:\r \xe2\x97\x8f A short description of the workshop describing the theme, methodology, implementation, type of activities planned, aims, research question, target audience and any specific technical requirement.\r\xe2\x97\x8f 3 to 5 Keywords\r\xe2\x97\x8f Workshops must state the modality to be used either online, in-person or hybrid.\r\xe2\x97\x8f If a specific online platform is required to facilitate the workshop, this must be stated in the proposal.\r All applications must be submitted through the Application Form available in our website.\r The full Call for Papers and Workshops can also be read in our website.\r Ventana 4 will be a hybrid event, in order to facilitate participation from scholars and postgraduates from all around the world. The conference will take place between the 5th and 7th of October 2022, in the city of York, UK.\r We would like to remind our applicants of our prolonged partnership with the journal Tens\xc3\xb5es Mundiais, of the Observat\xc3\xb3rio das Nacionalidades of the Universidade Estadual do Cear\xc3\xa1. This means that selected abstracts will have the opportunity to publish their papers after the conference. More information to come when the selection process is finished.\r For more information, please visit https://www.conferenciaventana.org/ \r All queries must be sent to conferenciaventana@gmail.com\r Looking forward to hear from you!\r Team Ventana\r\n'

title: b'JPM 2022'
description: b'AI, Augmentation and Art'
Categories: b'AI' b'augmented reality' b'art' b'creativity'
Call For Papers: b'\nIntegration of art and technology has proven to be both a help and\ra hindrance to both artists/creatives and consumers alike. For example,\rthe internet has permitted an increase in collaborative artistic practice,\ropportunities to share works of art with fans and friends, and has\rsometimes offset the financial burden of having to operate in a marketplace\rwhere it is \xe2\x80\x98unknown\xe2\x80\x99 how creativity will be received before its consumption.\rSome technological interventions have produced backlash and questions\rabout authentic creative practice. Musical artists, for instance, are criticized\rfor the ongoing use of autotune. Today, the gamut of this intersection of\rart and technology runs from the commercial side that has made \xe2\x80\x98real\xe2\x80\x99\rthe virtual actor across to the art side where the digital projection of\ranimated experiences of Van Gogh\xe2\x80\x99s greatest works populates the walls\rof entertainment facilities. Within this spectrum, technological influences,\raugmentations and directions are revolutionizing the production and\rconsumption of art, while others have undermined the symbolic nature of\rthese creative products.\rIn the twenty-first century, we are increasingly seeing the insertion of\rmachine creativity alongside or even on top of the human artist with greater\rattention needed on the role of the technical artefact in the entire creative\rprocess. Artistic expression has long been considered the purview of the\rpeople, when, in fact, more attention could be levelled at the influence of\rtechnology on creative products and experiences. What is clear is that\rartists and creatives continue to explore the capacity of technology to evolve\rtheir craft to make it more accessible, challenge genres and conventions, for\rboth commercial, educational, and intrinsic motivations.\rFor this Special Issue, we are interested in how changes in technology\rare directly impacting artists, creatives, producers and/or the consumer,\raficionado or fans to start conversations around issues such as \xe2\x80\x98where to\rnext?\xe2\x80\x99, \xe2\x80\x98what constitutes art?\xe2\x80\x99, \xe2\x80\x98has art lost its \xe2\x80\x9cmeaning\xe2\x80\x9d?\xe2\x80\x99, \xe2\x80\x98who is the real\rcreator/author?\xe2\x80\x99 or \xe2\x80\x98has creativity developed new meanings altogether?\xe2\x80\x99 The\rSpecial Issue will explore, then, whether the practices of art and creativity\rhinge on new forms of technological determinism and how technology is\rimpacting creative outputs and experiences from the movie set to the fine\rart gallery.\n\t'

title: b'EISA 2022'
description: b'The Third International Conference on Emerging Information Security and Applications'
Categories: b'security and privacy' b'security' b'blockchain'
Call For Papers: b'\nEISA 2022\rThe Third International Conference on Emerging Information Security and Applications (EISA)\r29-30 October, 2022, Wuhan China\r***This event will be held virtually***\rhttps://eisa.compute.dtu.dk/2022/\r===========================================================================\rA best paper award will be granted\rSpecial issues, e.g., IEEE TCE, IJIS, JISA, SCN, Heliyon CS\r ==================================\rSCOPE\r==================================\r With recent evolution of adversarial techniques, intrusions have become more complex that may threaten the security of various assets regarding information and applications. In addition, coordinated intrusions like worm outbreak can continue to be a major threat to information, system and network security in the near future. The popularity of Internet may generate a large volume of different types of sensitive information. Therefore, there is a need for emerging techniques, theories and applications to protect information and practical security.\r The Second International Symposium on Emerging Information Security and Applications (EISA) aims to provide a platform for researchers and practitioners across the world to exchange their ideas. It seeks original submissions that discuss practical or theoretical solutions to enhance the information and application security in practice.\r ==================================\rTOPICS OF INTEREST\r==================================\r - Cyber intelligence techniques\r- Multimedia security\r- Malware and unwanted software\r- Vulnerability analysis and reverse engineering\r- Usable security and privacy\r- Intrusion detection and prevention\r- Authentication and access control\r- Anonymity and privacy\r- Cryptographic protection\r- Digital forensics\r- Cyber physical systems security\r- Adversarial learning\r- Security measurement\r- Security management and policies\r- Hardware and physical security\r ==================================\rIMPORTANT DATES\r==================================\r Submission Deadline: 20 June 2022\rAcceptance Notification: 30 August 2022\rCamera Ready: 30 September 2022\r ==================================\rINSTRUCTIONS FOR PAPER SUBMISSION\r==================================\r Authors are invited to submit original papers. All papers need to be submitted electronically through the website (https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=eisa2022) with PDF format. Submitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal or a conference with proceedings. Papers must be clearly presented in English, must not exceed Full Paper - 18 pages (or up to 20 pages with the pages over length charge), Short Paper - 12 pages in Springer LNCS format (https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines), including tables, figures, references and appendices. Papers will be selected based on their originality, significance, relevance, and clarity of presentation assessed by at least three reviewers. Submission of a paper should be regarded as a commitment that, should the paper be accepted, at least one of the authors will register and attend the conference to present the work.\r ==================================\rBest Paper\r==================================\rA best paper award will be granted to the qualified papers.\r ==================================\rSpecial Issue\r==================================\rSelected papers from EISA 2022 will be invited to consider submission (after significant extension) for special issues. IJIS, JISA, Heliyon CS\r ==================================\rGeneral Chairs\rAnthony TS Ho, University of Surrey, UK\rSokratis K. Katsikas, Norwegian University of Science and Technology, Norway\rWeizhi Meng, Technical University of Denmark, Denmark\r Program Chairs\rDebiao He, Wuhan University, China\rRongxing Lu, University of New Brunswick, Canada\rJiageng Chen, Central China Normal University, China\rPublicity Chairs\rPei Li, Central China Normal University, China\rChunhua Su, University of Aizu, Japan\r Publication Chair\rShixiong Yao, Central China Normal University, China\rWenjuan Li, Hong Kong Polytechnic University, China\n\t'

title: b'IFL 2022'
description: b'The 34th Symposium on Implementation and Application of Functional Languages'
Categories: b'functional programming' b'programming languages' b'type systems' b'verification'
Call For Papers: b'\n# CALL FOR PAPERS - The 34th Symposium on Implementation and Application of Functional Languages\r ## Important dates\r Draft paper submission:    7th of August 2022\rDraft paper notification:  9th of August 2022\rRegistration deadline:    12th of August 2022\rSymposium:                31th of August to 2nd of September\r ## Scope\r The goal of the IFL symposia is to bring together researchers actively\rengaged in the implementation and application of functional and\rfunction-based programming languages. IFL 2022 will be a venue for\rresearchers to present and discuss new ideas and concepts, work in\rprogress, and publication-ripe results related to the implementation\rand application of functional languages and function-based\rprogramming.\r Topics of interest to IFL include, but are not limited to:\r * language concepts\r* type systems, type checking, type inferencing\r* compilation techniques\r* staged compilation\r* run-time function specialization\r* run-time code generation\r* partial evaluation\r* abstract interpretation\r* metaprogramming\r* generic programming\r* automatic program generation\r* array processing\r* concurrent/parallel programming\r* concurrent/parallel program execution\r* embedded systems\r* web applications\r* embedded domain specific languages\r* security\r* novel memory management techniques\r* run-time profiling performance measurements\r* debugging and tracing\r* virtual/abstract machine architectures\r* validation, verification of functional programs\r* tools and programming techniques\r* industrial applications\r ## Submissions and peer-review\r Following IFL tradition, IFL 2022 will use a post-symposium review\rprocess to produce the formal proceedings.\r Before the symposium authors submit draft papers. These draft papers\rwill be screened by the program chair to make sure that they are\rwithin the scope of IFL. The draft papers will be made available to\rall participants at the symposium. Each draft paper is presented by\rone of the authors at the symposium.\r After the symposium, a formal review process will take place,\rconducted by the program committee.  Reviewing is single blind. There\rwill be at least 3 reviews per paper. The reviewers have 6 weeks to\rwrite their reviews. For the camera-ready version the authors can make\rminor revisions which are accepted without further reviewing.\r ## Where\r IFL 2022 will be held physically in Copenhagen, Denmark, arranged by\rDIKU at the University of Copenhagen.\r See the IFL 2022 website at https://ifl22.github.io/ for more\rinformation.\r\n'

title: b'Neurodisorder-AAP 2022'
description: b'Selective Treatment Strategies for Neurodegenerative Disorders using Nanomedicine'
Categories: b'health care' b'neurodisorder' b'nanomedicine' b'drug delivery'
Call For Papers: b"\nNeurological illnesses have a large influence on our society. CNS disorders, particularly neurodegenerative disorders, are a serious public health concern that necessitates a considerable amount of attention from researchers to protect people from them. These diseases are caused by a wide range of problems with the way neurons communicate with each other. They include neurodegenerative and metabolic diseases that are controlled by neural connections.\rVarious treatment procedures have been implemented over the last few decades, but their therapeutic success has been insufficient, resulting in only partial symptom relief. The blood-cerebrospinal fluid barrier (BSCFB), and the blood-brain barrier (BBB) protect the CNS from harmful substances and pose significant challenges in delivering drugs into the CNS for the treatment of CNS complications such as Parkinson's disease, brain tumors, Alzheimer's disease, multiple sclerosis, Huntington's disease, encephalitis, and so on. Nanomedicines can efficiently deliver therapeutics to the brain, implying favorable outcomes in the treatment of neuron-related illnesses. \rMolecules can be nanoengineered to perform a variety of functions, including crossing the BBB, targeting specific cells or signaling pathways, responding to endogenous stimuli, acting as a vehicle for gene delivery, and supporting nerve regeneration and cell survival. The role of nanocarrier systems such as Nanodiamonds, liposomes, micelles, solid lipid nanoparticles (SLNPs), dendrimers, and nanoemulsions in the delivery of various neurotherapeutic agents has been discussed in this book, as well as their mechanism of action and nanoformulation of different neuroprotective agents and nerve growth factors. \rThis book will shed light on nanomedicines' great potential for effectively delivering treatments to the brain, revealing promising outcomes in the treatment of neuron-related disorders. This book will also recognize the tremendous distance between the bench and the bedside, as well as the limits of present tactics.\r Editors:\r Dr. Rishabha Malviya\rGalgotias University, India\r  Dr. Kamla Pathak\rUttar Pradesh University of Medical Sciences, Saifai, Etawah, India.\r Swati Verma\rGalgotias University, India\r  Table of content (but not limited to):\r 1.\tIntroduction to Nano formulation\r2.\tA synopsis of Neurodegenerative disorders\r3.\tUse of Nano formulations in the treatment of Neurodegenerative disorders\r4.\tImplication of Herbal Nano formulation in the treatment of Neurological disorders\r5.\tClinical strategies, Management and Challenges in targeting Neuro disorders\r6.\tApplication of Medicinal plants and their Phytoconstituents\r7.\tAdvantages of Nano formulation in the treatment of NDs\r8.\tCurrent trends in drug Nano formulations directed to brain\r9.\tObstacles to BBB-targeted drug delivery\r10.\tOverview of BBB transport mechanisms \r11.\tThe Real issue in targeting neurodegenerative disease\r12.\tOverview of techniques employed for the preparation of Nano formulation\r13.\tNano approaches towards CNS Drug delivery\r14.\tNeuronal targeting with nano-based approaches\r15.\tOverview of BBB Bypass Strategies \r16.\tApplication of Nanodiamonds in the treatment of neuro disorders\r Book will be published in Apple Academic Press, Taylor and Francis.\r Contact Details:\r editor.rishabha@gmail.com\r+91-9450352185\r \n"

title: b'EAI CloudComp 2022'
description: b'12th EAI International Conference on Cloud Computing'
locality: b"Hong Kong, People's Republic of China"
Call For Papers: b'\nScope\rAs a novel computing paradigm, cloud computing has changed the world tremendously in the past two decades. It offers scalable computing and storage resources as services to support various applications cost-effectively and flexibly. It has also promoted the proliferation of big data analytics and deep learning in the last decade. Currently, cloud computing is continuing to power and drive technological development and advances in various areas such as industrial manufacturing, medical healthcare, intelligent transportation, smart city, e-government, e-commerce and e-finance, etc. It is also the backbone for the emerging edge/fog computing technologies and Internet of Things (IoT) applications, which constitute a rapidly-evolving ecosystem that profoundly changes the world\xe2\x80\x99s IT landscape and people\xe2\x80\x99s lives.\rCloudComp 2022 aims to bring together researchers and industry developers to discuss and share their recent viewpoints and contributions on cloud computing, It aims to present recent theories, experiences and results obtained in a wide area relevant to computing, giving researchers and industrial practitioners an opportunity to gain in-depth insight on the current and futuristic cloud computing technologies.\r Topics\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCloud Architecture\r\xef\x80\xad\tX as a Service Paradigms\r\xef\x80\xad\tCloud Computing Architecture\r\xef\x80\xad\tPublic/Private/Hybrid Cloud\r\xef\x80\xad\tEdge Computing / Fog Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tIoT/Sensor Clouds\r\xef\x80\xad\tSimulation and Virtualization in Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tCloud Data Management Architecture\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCloud Management\r\xef\x80\xad\tCloud Resource Scheduling and Computation Offloading\r\xef\x80\xad\tEdge Resource Management and Optimization\r\xef\x80\xad\tQuality of Service (QoS) in Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tCost Models and Optimization in Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tPrivacy, Security and Trust Issues in Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tHeterogeneity in Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tEnergy-saving Issue in Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tCloud Data Management\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCloud Applications\r\xef\x80\xad\tCloud Computing for Big Data Processing\r\xef\x80\xad\tHigh Performance Computing based on Cloud\r\xef\x80\xad\tCloud Supported Smart X Technologies\r\xef\x80\xad\tDistributed and Parallel Query Processing\r\xef\x80\xad\t5G and Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tBlockchain Techniques for Cloud Computing\r\xef\x80\xad\tEdge Computing Applications\r Publication\rAll registered papers will be submitted for publishing by Springer and made available through SpringerLink Digital Library. Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, IO-Port, MatchSciNet, Inspec and Zentralblatt MATH.\rAuthors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version to:\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tWireless Networks (WINET) Journal [IF: 2.602 (2020)]\rAll accepted authors are eligible to submit an extended version in a fast track of:\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tEAI Endorsed Transactions on Cloud Systems\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tEAI Endorsed Transactions on Scalable Information Systems\rAdditional publication opportunities:\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tSensors\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tEAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series\r(titles in this series are indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)\r Paper submission\rPapers should be submitted through EAI \xe2\x80\x98Confy+\xe2\x80\x98 system, and have to comply with the Springer format (see Author\xe2\x80\x99s kit section).\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tRegular papers should be up to 10-20 pages in length.\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tShort papers should be 8-10 pages in length.\rAll conference papers undergo a thorough peer review process prior to the final decision and publication. This process is facilitated by experts in the Technical Program Committee during a dedicated conference period. Standard peer review is enhanced by EAI Community Review which allows EAI members to bid to review specific papers. All review assignments are ultimately decided by the responsible Technical Program Committee Members while the Technical Program Committee Chair is responsible for the final acceptance selection. You can learn more about Community Review here.\r Important dates\rFull Paper Submission deadline: 30 August 2022\rNotification deadline: 20 October 2022\rCamera-ready deadline: 1 November 2022\rStart of Conference: 8 December 2022\rEnd of Conference: 9 December 2022\r\n'

title: b'DependSys 2022'
description: b'8th IEEE International Conference on Dependability in Sensor, Cloud & Big Data Systems & Applications'
Call For Papers: b'\nIEEE DependSys 2022 conference is the 8th event in the series of conferences which offers a timely venue for bringing together new ideas, techniques, and solutions for dependability and its issues in sensor, cloud, and big data systems and applications. As we are deep into the Information Age, huge amounts of data are generated every day from sensors, individual archives, social networks, Internet of Things, enterprises and Internet in various scales and format which will pose a major challenge to the dependability of our designed systems. As these systems oftentend to become inert, fragile, and vulnerable after a period of running. Effectively improving the dependability of sensor, cloud, big data systems and applications has become increasingly critical.\r This conference provides a forum for individuals, academics, practitioners, and organizations who are developing or procuring sophisticated computer systems on whose dependability of services they need to place great confidence. Future systems need to close the dependability gap in face of challenges in different circumstances. The emphasis will be on differing properties of such services, e.g., continuity, effective performance, real-time responsiveness, corruption, anomaly, ability to avoid catastrophic failures, prevention of deliberate privacy intrusions, reliability, availability, sustainability, adaptability, heterogeneity, security, safety, and so on.\r Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\rTrack 1: Dependability and Security Fundamentals and Technologies\r-Concepts, theory, and methodologies\r-Dependability of sensor, networks\r-Dependability issues in cloud/fog/edge\r-Security and privacy\r-Security/privacy in cloud/fog/edge\r-Artificial intelligence\r-Big data foundation and management\r-Dependable IoT supporting technologies\rTrack 2 : Dependable and Secure Systems\r-Dependable sensor systems\r-Dependability issues in distributed systems\r-Cyber-physical systems\r-Database and transaction processing systems\r-Safety and security in distributed systems\r-Dependability in automotive systems\r-Dependability in big data systems\r-Software system security\r-Blockchain-based systems\rTrack 3: Dependable and Secure Applications\r-Sensor and robot applications\r-Big data applications\r-Cloud/fog/edge applications\r-Safety care, medical care and services\r-Aerospace, transportation applications\r-Energy, smart city, smart grid\r-IoT, CPS and industrial application\rTrack 4 : Dependability and Security Measures and Assessments\r-Metrics and measures for safety, trust, faith\r-Levels and assessment criteria and authority\r-Dependability measurement, modeling\r-Dependability evaluation\r-Software reliability and verification\r-Hardware reliability and verification\r-Evaluations and tools\r Paper Submission Guidelines\rThe materials presented in the papers should not be published or under submission elsewhere. Each paper is limited to 8 pages (or 10 pages with over length charge) including figures and references using IEEE Computer Society Proceedings Manuscripts style (two columns, single- spaced, 10 fonts). All papers need to be submitted electronically through the conference submission website with PDF: Coming soon\r Paper Publication\rAccepted conference papers will be published by IEEE (IEEE-DL and El indexed). At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register and present their work at the conference; Otherwise, the paper will not be included in the proceedings. Selected papers, after further extensions and revisions, will be recommended to special issues.\r Important Dates\rSpecial Session: 30 June, 2022\rPaper Submission Deadline: 01 September, 2022\rAuthors Notification: 15 October, 2022\rFinal Manuscript Due: 10 November, 2022\n\t'

title: b'DBA 2022'
description: b'CFP 2022 Dress and Body Association Conference (November 5-6, 2022)'
Categories: b'online conferences' b'dress' b'body' b'interdisciplinary'
Call For Papers: b'\n2022 Dress and Body Association Conference\r The Beginner\xe2\x80\x99s Mind:\rAsking and Telling About Dress Studies\r November 5-6, 2022\r CALL FOR PAPERS\r The Dress and Body Association invites submissions for the organization\xe2\x80\x99s third annual conference, which will be held on November 5-6, 2022. Consistent with our long-term goals for inclusivity and sustainability, all activities will be 100% online, including keynote speaker(s), research presentations, and opportunities for virtual networking. Visit the DBA website to learn more about this new organization: dress-body-association.org.\r The Beginner\xe2\x80\x99s Mind: Asking and Telling About Dress Studies\r Dress studies is an interdisciplinary field that intersects with many others, including (but definitely not limited to) area studies, gender and sexuality, sociology, art history, media studies, theater, philosophy, design, fashion studies, and anthropology. We welcome presentations about any aspect of dress and/or the body that are drawn from ongoing research, teaching, artistic, and/or activist ventures, however this year we are asking presenters to use a little of their time to reflect on their engagement with dress studies.\r If you\xe2\x80\x99re new to this field\xe2\x80\xa6\r What questions do you have?\r How did you first encounter dress studies?\r How is dress and/or the body viewed within your discipline?\r What/how can your discipline contribute to scholarship on dress and/or the body?\r If you\xe2\x80\x99re not new to dress studies\xe2\x80\xa6\r How did you first get involved?\r Is there anything you wish you had known earlier?\r What have been some of the key texts/theories/methods for you?  How have they guided/influenced your work?\r Where would you locate the untapped potentials/opportunities of dress studies as an inherently interdisciplinary field of study?\r Submissions will be accepted from any discipline as long as the topic relates to this broad theme. Both beginning and advanced scholars are welcome. Abstracts should be 200-300 words. Presenters do not need to submit a paper before the conference, but should plan to speak for up to 30 minutes with time for discussion at the end of each panel.\r Although we welcome scholars from any country, the language of the conference will be English. We will consider a panel in another language if there is sufficient interest from a group of scholars. Abstracts must be written in English and should be drawn from original research; we ask that presenters not simply recycle lectures from other conferences. The DBA welcomes creative approaches and non-traditional presentations.\r For best consideration, please submit your abstract by August 1, 2022. All submissions will be read by at least two reviewers in a single-blind review process. Authors can expect to receive notification of acceptance within 2 to 3 weeks after the deadline.  \r Registration through the DBA website will be required for access to the online platform.  Donations are welcome, but not required to participate. The recommended donation is 20 USD for students and early-career scholars, 50 USD for mid-career and senior scholars. \r To submit an abstract: dress-body-association.org/abstracts\r To register for the conference: dress-body-association.org/conference-registration\r Mission Statement of the Dress and Body Association\r\xe2\x80\x9cDress\xe2\x80\x9d is a highly inclusive concept that includes all varieties of body supplements and body modifications* found in human cultures around the world. It is not limited to clothing, costume, or fashion or to any particular time, place, or economic structure. The mission of the Dress and Body Association (DBA) is to bring together scholars from diverse disciplines and areas of the world to share academic research about dress and body practices understood broadly, to offer quality opportunities for networking, and to forge links with like-minded individuals and organizations.\r The Dress and Body Association is based entirely online, an essential structure for\r1) Flexibility: In-person conferences are cumbersome and expensive to plan, which makes them difficult to change or adapt to new circumstances.\r2) Accessibility: Travel is expensive and time-consuming. Many scholars cannot afford to travel.  Even scholars with funding may have restrictions due to caretaking responsibilities, health issues, difficulty obtaining a visa, etc.  \r3) Inclusivity: \xe2\x80\x98Dress and the body\xe2\x80\x99 is a subject that pertains to all human cultures, the DBA is committed to including scholars from diverse disciplines and areas of the world.\r4) Sustainability: International travel is not only expensive, but harmful to the planet. Online activities reduce consumption and waste.\r *Joanne B. Eicher (2000), \xe2\x80\x9cDress,\xe2\x80\x9d Routledge International Encyclopedia of Women: Global Women\xe2\x80\x99s Issues and Knowledge, edited by Cheris Kramarae and Dale Spender, New York, Routledge: 422-423.\r The Dress and Body Association is registered as a non-profit organization (501(c)(3)) in the state of Indiana (United States).  Donations are tax-deductible.\r Dress & Body Association | dress.body.assoc@gmail.com\n\t'

title: b"Sheridan's West 2022"
description: b'Taylor Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s Wests (Edited Volume) **Deadline: June 15, 2022**'
Categories: b'american west' b'post-west' b'television' b'film'
Call For Papers: b'\nCall for Papers\rTaylor Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s Wests\r Writing for Deadline in a piece conceived as a \xe2\x80\x9cWelcome to Taylor Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s universe,\xe2\x80\x9d Mike Fleming characterized the actor-turned-writer/director\xe2\x80\x99s rapidly growing oeuvre as \xe2\x80\x9ca place different from any other in the Hollywood landscape.\xe2\x80\x9d What makes Sheridan and his television shows and movies \xe2\x80\x98different\xe2\x80\x99 is the simple fact that they are positioned in the current entertainment landscape as west of the rest. His writing and directorial credits have coalesced around Western spaces, lifeworlds, and characters, ranging from his breakthrough script for Sicario (2015) to the television phenomenon that is Yellowstone (2018\xe2\x80\x93), which has become a beachhead for an evolving ecology of television content (1883 [2021\xe2\x80\x93], 1932 [forthcoming], 6666 [forthcoming], etc.). Seeking to highlight the fastest-growing geo-cultural region in the United States, Taylor Sheridan advances expansive views of the West that are deliberately complex, difficult, and challenging. In short, his creative output posits that the West, with its interweavings of history and mythography, matters.\r Consequently, the proposed book project seeks to assemble a collection of original contributions (6,000-8,000 words) which map and assess Taylor Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s Wests. We welcome equally proposals for works that pursue thematic through-lines cutting across Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s growing catalogue and for in-depth readings of individual movie and/or television titles. We invite proposals from scholars at all stages of their careers. Possible topic areas and/or themes include but are by no means limited to:\r * Shedding light on the effects of the Necrocene/Capitalocene in the West\r* (Mis)representing Native American lifeworlds and sovereignty (e.g. Land Back discourses, the pathology of settler colonialism, etc.)\r* Excavating \xe2\x80\x9cflyover country\xe2\x80\x9d from mainstream neglect\r* Spatial liminalities: border crossings, border spaces, liminal characters\r* Post-West(ern) poetics, revisionist discourses, the appeal and pitfalls of western nostalgia\r* Tall tales, western humor, cowboy antics\r* Neo-pastoralism\r* Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s Wests as New-New American Gothic?\r* Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cauthenticity work\xe2\x80\x9d (e.g. livestock raising, husbandry, and horsemanship economies, sartorial aesthetics and accoutrements of Western life, firearms, extraction and surveillance technologies, etc.)\r* Ecocritical readings of Sheridan\xe2\x80\x99s work (e.g. land ownership versus stewardship, human-non-human interfaces, etc.)\r* Masculinities, aging, toxic, redemptive, and otherwise\r* Ethics of law and/or justice\r* Violence and exploitation: abject spaces, bodies, and acts\r* Transmedia (f)ranchising and fandom: intersections between texts, paratexts (e.g. podcasts, aftershows, etc.), and invested audiences (e.g. Yellowstone fanfiction, social media, etc.)\r* Sonic Wests: soundscapes, soundtracks, etc.\r If you are interested in proposing a chapter, please email an abstract of 500\xe2\x80\x93700 words to taylorsheridanswests@gmail.com. Your abstract should outline your working thesis and briefly sketch the theoretical/methodological framework(s) within which your chapter will be situated. All submissions will be acknowledged. If you do not receive a confirmation of receipt within 48 hours, you may assume that your email fell prey to the vagaries of the world wide web. In that case, please resend your abstract. Please note that we will not include previously published essays in the collection.\r Feel free to contact us at the email address indicated above with any questions or concerns you might have.\r Tentative roadmap\rJune 15, 2022: abstract deadline\rJuly 31, 2022: notification of acceptance/rejection (Please note: Acceptance of your abstract does not automatically guarantee your chapter\xe2\x80\x99s inclusion in the collection.)\rDecember 22, 2022: first drafts due\rFebruary 29, 2023: feedback on first drafts\rExpected publication: 2024\r  Editorial team\rPawe\xc5\x82 Pyrka (SWPS University Warsaw)\rStefan Rabitsch (University of Graz/University of Warsaw)\rAnna Warso (SWPS University Warsaw)\rNicolas S. Witschi (Western Michigan University)\n\t'

title: b'SUMAC 2022'
description: b'The 4th workshop on Structuring and Understanding of Multimedia HeritAge Contents, in conjunction with ACM Multimedia 2022'
Categories: b'cultural heritage' b'multimedia data processing' b'machine learning' b'content analysis'
Call For Papers: b'\nCALL FOR PAPERS \xe2\x80\x93 SUMAC 2022\r THE 4TH WORKSHOP ON STRUCTURING AND UNDERSTANDING OF MULTIMEDIA HERITAGE CONTENTS (SUMAC), IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACM MULTIMEDIA 2022\r Date: 10 October 2022\rVenue: Lisbon (Portugal)\rAttendance mode: hybrid\r WEBSITE SUMAC WORKSHOP: https://sumac-workshops.github.io/2022\rWEBSITE ACM MULTIMEDIA 2022: https://2022.acmmm.org\r AIMS AND SCOPE\rThe digitization of large quantities of analogue data and the massive production of born-digital documents for many years now provide us with large volumes of varied multimedia data (images, maps, text, video, multi-sensor data, etc.), an important feature of which is that they are cross-domain. \xe2\x80\x9cCross-domain\xe2\x80\x9d reflects the fact that these data may have been acquired in very different conditions: different acquisition systems, times and points of view. These data represent an extremely rich heritage that can be exploited in a wide variety of fields, from Social Sciences and Humanities to land use and territorial policies, including smart city, urban planning, smart tourism and culture, creative media and entertainment. In terms of research in computer science, they address challenging problems related to the diversity and volume of the media across time, the variety of content descriptors (potentially including the time dimension), the veracity of the data, and the different user needs with respect to engaging with this rich material and the extraction of value out of the data. These challenges are reflected in various research topics such as multimodal and mixed media search, automatic content analysis, multimedia linking and recommendation, and big data analysis and visualization, where scientific bottlenecks may be exacerbated by the time dimension, which also provides topics of interest such as multimodal time series analysis.\r The objective of this edition is to present and discuss the latest and most significant trends in the analysis, structuring and understanding of multimedia contents dedicated to the valorization of heritage, with the emphasis on enabling access to the big data of the past. We welcome research contributions for the following (but not limited to) topics:\r Multimedia and cross-domain data interlinking and recommendation\rDating and spatialization of historical data\rMixed media data access and indexing\rDeep learning in adverse conditions (transfer learning, learning with side information, etc.)\rMulti-modal time series analysis, evolution modelling\rMulti-modal and multi-temporal data rendering\rHeritage \xe2\x80\x93 Building Information Modelling, Art Virtualisation\rHCI / Interfaces for large-scale datasets\rSmart digitisation of massive quantities of data\rBench-marking, Open Data Movement\rGenerative modelling of cultural heritage\r IMPORTANT DATES\rPaper submission: 8 July 2022 (11:59 p.m. AoE)\rAuthor acceptance notification: 26 July 2022\rCamera-Ready: 7 August 2022\rWorkshop date: 10 October 2022\r SUBMISSION GUIDELINES\rAll submissions must be original work not under review at any other workshop, conference or journal. The workshop will accept papers describing completed work as well as work in progress. One submission format is accepted: full paper, which must follow the formatting guidelines of the main conference ACM MM 2022. Full papers should be from 6 to 8 pages (plus 2 additional pages for the references), encoded as PDF and using the ACM Article Template.\r PAPER GUIDELINES\rPeer Review and publication in ACM Digital Library. Paper submissions must conform with the \xe2\x80\x9cdouble-blind\xe2\x80\x9d review policy. All papers will be peer-reviewed by experts in the field, they will receive at least two reviews. Acceptance will be based on relevance to the workshop, scientific novelty, and technical quality. Depending on the number, maturity and topics of the accepted submissions, the work will be presented via oral or poster sessions. The workshop papers will be published in the ACM Digital Library.\r ORGANIZERS\rValerie Gouet-Brunet (LaSTIG Lab / IGN \xe2\x80\x93 Gustave Eiffel University, France)\rRonak Kosti (Philipps-Universit\xc3\xa4t Marburg, Germany)\rLi Weng (Hangzhou Dianzi University, China)\r Looking forward to seeing you in Lisbon!\rThe workshop organizers\n\t'

Call For Papers: b'\nBANDUNG-BELGRADE-HAVANA IN GLOBAL HISTORY AND PERSPECTIVE:\rWhat Dreams, What Challenges, What Projects for a Global Future?\r INTERNATIONAL, INTER-AND-TRANS-DISCIPLINARY CONFERENCE\r66th Anniversary of the Bandung Asian-African Conference\r60th Anniversary of the Belgrade Non-Alignment Conference\r55th Anniversary of the Havana Tricontinental Conference\rJakarta-Bandung-Surabaya-Bali, Indonesia, November 7-13, 2022\rIn Conjunction with the G20 Summit, Bali, November 15-16, 2022\rGeneral information: https://bandungspirit.org/\rInquiry: secretariat-bbh@e-group.bandungspirit.org\rAddress for abstract submission: https://forms.gle/aWVKdMkDWgAf8LMYA\r Following the change of dates of the G20 Summit in Bali, Indonesia, from October 30-31 to November 15-16, 2022, we have rescheduled our conference to November 7-13, 2022, so that the end of our conference be close to the beginning of the G20 Summit.\r Under the theme of "What dreams, what challenges, what projects for a global future?", the conference is open to proposals of paper to be presented in the conference and to be selected for publication. The conference welcomes proposals dealing with dreams, challenges and projects in diverse fields (culture, ecology, economy, politic, religion...) and higlighted under diverse academic disciplines (humanities, history, literature, anthropology, politics, economics, sociology, gender studies, area studies, urban studies...). Here are examples of issues to be discussed in the conference:\r- Gender and Women\xe2\x80\x99s issues\r- Ecology/Global Health/Biodiversity/Sustainability (Human and Nature)\r- Demography/Migration/Rural-Urban Issues\r- Digital Transformation/Culture/Business\r- Geopolitical Economy/International Trade/WTO/Finance/Dedollarisation/Delinking\r- Revolutions/Decolonisation/Social Movements/Rehabilitation-Enhancement of Indigenous Rights\r- National Sovereignty/Global Interdependency/Global & Regional Security/Arms control\r- Counter Hegemony/BRICS & NAM Synergy\r- South-South & North-South Exchanges and Cooperation/Africa-Asia-Latin America Exchanges-Cooperation-Solidarity\r- Interfaith/Interreligious/Intercultural/Exogenous-Endogenous Dialogue/Syncretism/Eclectism/Fusion/Integration\r- Bandungism and Bandung School of Global Studies\r- Cybernetic strategic economic planning at the service of the people\r NEW DEADLINE OF ABSTRACTS SUBMISSION: June 30, 2022.\rThe papers presented in the conference will be considered for a publication in a journal partner of the conference or in a book of selected papers. You find the guidelines for abstract submission and other information at https://bandungspirit.org/\r COORDINATORS:\rDarwis Khudori, Indonesia/France (Universit\xc3\xa9 Le Havre Normandie, France, Faculty of International Affairs, GRIC Research Group on Identities and Cultures, Director of Master\'s Degree in Exchanges with Asia)\rIsaac Bazi\xc3\xa9, Burkina Faso/Canada (Universit\xc3\xa9 du Qu\xc3\xa9bec \xc3\xa0 Montr\xc3\xa9al, Canada, Director of LAFI Laboratoire des Afriques Innovantes, President of CAAS Canadian Association of African Studies, Chief Editor of Journal Afroglobe African Issues, in local and global Perspectives)\r Contact Info: \rDarwis Khudori, Faculty of International Affairs, University Le Havre Normandy, France\rContact Email: secretariat-bbh@e-group.bandungspirit.org\rURL: https://bandungspirit.org/\n\t'
