title: b'REX-IO 2022'
description: b'2nd Workshop on Re-envisioning Extreme-Scale I/O for Emerging Hybrid HPC Workloads @ IEEE Cluster 2022'
Categories: b'parallel i/o' b'HPC' b'parallel storage' b'file systems'
Call For Papers: b'\n*********************************************************************\r Call for Papers\r REX-IO 2022: 2nd Workshop on Re-envisioning Extreme-Scale I/O for\rEmerging Hybrid HPC Workloads\r Held in conjunction with IEEE Cluster 2022, Heidelberg, Germany.\r Workshop Date: September 6, 2022\r (https://sites.google.com/view/rexio/)\r *********************************************************************\r ================================\rScope, Aims, and Topics\r================================\rHigh Performance Computing (HPC) applications are evolving to include not only traditional scale-up modeling and simulation bulk-synchronous workloads but also scale-out workloads like artificial intelligence (AI), data analytics methods, deep learning, big data and complex multi-step workflows. Exascale workflows are projected to include multiple different components from both scale-up and scale-out communities operating together to drive scientific discovery and innovation. With the often conflicting design choices between optimizing for write-intensive vs. read-intensive, having flexible I/O systems will be crucial to support these hybrid workloads. Another performance aspect is the intensifying complexity of parallel file and storage systems in large-scale cluster environments. Storage system designs are advancing beyond the traditional two-tiered file system and archive model by introducing new tiers of temporary, fast storage close to the computing resources with distinctly different performance characteristics. \r The changing landscape of emerging hybrid HPC workloads along with the ever increasing gap between the compute and storage performance capabilities reinforces the need for an in-depth understanding of extreme-scale I/O and for rethinking existing data storage and management techniques. Traditional approaches of managing data might fail to address the challenges of extreme-scale hybrid workloads. Novel I/O optimization and management techniques integrating machine learning and AI algorithms, such as intelligent load balancing and I/O pattern prediction, are needed to ease the handling of the exponential growth of data as well as the complex hierarchies in the storage and file systems. Furthermore, user-friendly, transparent and innovative approaches are essential to adapt to the needs of different HPC I/O workloads while easing the scientific and commercial code development and efficiently utilizing extreme-scale parallel I/O and storage resources.\r Established at IEEE Cluster 2021, the Re-envisioning Extreme-Scale I/O for Emerging Hybrid HPC Workloads (REX-IO) workshop has created a forum for experts, researchers, and engineers in the parallel I/O and storage, compute facility operation, and HPC application domains. REX-IO solicits novel work that characterizes I/O behavior and identifies the challenges in scientific data and storage management for emerging HPC workloads, introduces potential solutions to alleviate some of these challenges, and demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed solutions to improve I/O performance for the exascale supercomputing era and beyond. We envision that this workshop will contribute to the community and further drive discussions between storage and I/O researchers, HPC application users and the data analytics community to give a better in-depth understanding of the impact on the storage and file systems induced by emerging HPC applications.\r Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r- Understanding I/O inefficiencies in emerging workloads such as complex multi-step workflows, in-situ analysis, AI, and data analytics methods  \r- New I/O optimization techniques, including how ML and AI algorithms might be adapted for intelligent load balancing and I/O pattern prediction of complex, hybrid application workloads\r- Performance benchmarking, resource management, and I/O behavior studies of emerging workloads\r- New possibilities for the I/O optimization of emerging application workloads and their I/O subsystems\r- Efficient tools for the monitoring of metadata and storage hardware statistics at runtime, dynamic storage resource management, and I/O load balancing\r- Parallel file systems, metadata management, and complex data management\r- Understanding and efficiently utilizing complex storage hierarchies beyond the traditional two-tiered file system and archive model\r- User-friendly tools and techniques for managing data movement among compute and storage nodes\r- Use of staging areas, such as burst buffers or other private or shared acceleration tiers for managing intermediate data between computation tasks\r- Application of emerging big data frameworks towards scientific computing and analysis\r- Alternative data storage models, including object and key-value stores, and scalable software architectures for data storage and archive\r- Data movement for HPC on edge devices\r- Position papers on related topics\r ================================\rSubmission Guidelines\r================================\rAll papers must be original and not simultaneously submitted to another journal or conference. Indicate all authors and affiliations. All papers will be peer-reviewed using a single-blind peer-review process by at least three members of the program committee. Submissions should be a complete manuscript. Full paper submissions should not exceed 6 single-spaced, double-column pages using 10-point size font on 8.5 X 11 inch pages (IEEE conference style, https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html) including everything excluding references.\r Papers are to be submitted electronically in PDF format through EasyChair. Submitted papers should not have appeared in or be under consideration for a different workshop, conference or journal. It is also expected that all accepted papers will be presented at the workshop by one of the authors.\r All accepted papers (subject to post-review revisions) will be published in the IEEE Cluster 2022 proceedings.\r Submission Link: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=rexio22\r ================================\rImportant Dates\r================================\r- Submissions open: May 3, 2022\r- Submission deadline: July 10, 2022, 11:59PM AoE (FINAL EXTENSION)\r- Notification to authors: July 21, 2022\r- Camera-ready paper due: July 25, 2025\r- Workshop date: September 6, 2022 \r ================================\rWorkshop Committees\r================================\rWorkshop Co-Chairs:\r- Arnab K. Paul (BITS Pilani, K K Birla Goa Campus, India) (arnabp AT goa DOT bits-pilani DOT ac DOT in) \r- Sarah M. Neuwirth (Goethe-University Frankfurt, Germany) (s.neuwirth AT em DOT uni-frankfurt DOT de)\r- Jay Lofstead (Sandia National Laboratories, USA) (gflofst AT sandia DOT gov)\r Program Committee:\r- Ali Anwar (University of Minnesota, USA)\r- Scott Atchley (Oak Ridge National Laboratory, USA)\r- Jean Luca Bez (Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, USA)\r- Thomas Boenisch (High-Performance Computing Center Stuttgart (HLRS), Germany)\r- Suren Byna (Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, USA)\r- Phil Carns (Argonne National Laboratory, USA)\r- Yue Cheng (Goerge Mason University, USA)\r- Wei Der Chien (The University of Edinburgh, UK)\r- Hariharan Devarajan (Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, USA)\r- Awais Khan (Oak Ridge National Laboratory, USA)\r- Youngjae Kim (Sogang University, South Korea)\r- Julian Kunkel (Georg-August-Universit\xc3\xa4t G\xc3\xb6ttingen/GWDG, Germany)\r- Ricardo Macedo (INESC TEC & University of Minho, Portugal)\r- Houjun Tang (Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, USA)\r- Bing Xie (Oak Ridge National Laboratory, USA)\r- Nannan Zhao (Northwestern Polytechnical University, China)\r- Mai Zheng (Iowa State University, USA)\n\t'

title: b'WAISC 2022'
description: b'Workshop on AI & Digital Twins for Smart Cities'
Categories: b'digital twins' b'smart cities' b'agent-based systems' b'computer science'
Call For Papers: b'\nWORKSHOP ON AI & DIGITAL TWINS FOR SMART CITIES\rWorkshop at KI2022 in Trier, Germany\rSeptember 19\xe2\x80\x9323, 2022\r   Workshop Website:   https://waisc2022.dfki.de/\r  Conference Website: https://ki2022.gi.de/\r  Smart cities are a collective term for the use of information technology in urban context. As a subfield, digital twins for cities is a promising topic with unexplored potential. Both topics are influenced by different spheres of AI: acquisition and evaluation of big data, semantic technologies, agent-based modeling/distributed simulation, but also the human-computer interaction challenges that arise from the work with digital twins. As such, both topics are deeply nested in the context of the KI2022 conference. In this workshop, we aim to examine the different angles, challenges and technologies from which the smart city concept can benefit from AI and digital twins. We call for extended abstracts on past works and experience, demonstrations of implemented systems and presentations of novel research questions and ideas to promote a joint discussion on how the use of digital twins for smart cities can be advanced by means of AI to address future challenges.\r Topics include but are not limited to:\r  - What constitutes a digital twin for a smart city, and how can this information be represented adequately in order to allow the application of AI while at the same time protecting the rights and interests of citizens and society?\r  - Is a digital twin in a smart city just a simulation or a semantic data space?\r  - What are online and offline properties of smart city applications?\r  - What are successful implementations of digital twins for smart cities, esp. with a focus on AI?\r  - How can aspects of transparency and explainability be supported?\r  - Which organizational structures are required to design, build, and use a digital twin for smart cities?\r  - How do citizens interact with smart city applications? What is required to ensure their broad acceptance?\r Submission:\r  - Extended abstracts may consist of up to 3 pages (excl. references) \r  - Presentation of extended abstracts and panel discussions\r  - Joint publication of postproceedings in thematic groups\r Format and schedule:\rThe workshop is planned to be a physical event. All accepted submissions will be grouped into related topic blocks, during which each participant presents their contribution in a 10 minute presentation. Each block is concluded by a panel talk, summarizing common findings, experiences and problems encountered in this topic block.\r Organizers:\r  Falco Nogatz, Veronika Kurchyna, Ingo J. Timm, \r  Benjamin Weyers, Fabian Lorig, Martin Memmel\r Workshop website:\r  https://waisc2022.dfki.de/\r\n'

title: b'AIMLSF 2022'
description: b'Advanced Concepts of AI and ML for Smart Future'
Call For Papers: b'\nCALL FOR BOOK CHAPTERS\r BOOK TITLE: Advanced Concepts of AI and ML for Smart Future\rAbout the book: The book will focus on the cutting-edge research in the area of Smart applications of AI and ML, ranging from the fundamentals, novel algorithms, advanced concepts and algorithms, experimental results, security and privacy challenges, etc. The primary objective of this book is to identify the trends in the field of AI integrated with ML, and to dig out various efficient solutions for promoting smart applications for a better future. This investigates the recent technological advancements and achievements in the said area and also it aims to discover the recent trends in AI and ML to promote and publish original articles in the relevant field of integration of machine learning and artificial intelligence in various aspects of smart future applications. This book will also provide the future research directions of AI-ML in terms of offering better solutions for smart and safe future. \r Table of Contents:\rThe topics are related to but not limited to the following:\r\xef\x83\x98\tEra of computational AI and ML techniques for smart intelligent systems.\r\xef\x83\x98\tState of the Art of Artificial Intelligence Approaches towards future applications.\r\xef\x83\x98\tMachine Learning Algorithms for smart intelligent decisions.\r\xef\x83\x98\tInnovations in Smart applications Using AI and ML.\r\xef\x83\x98\tIntegration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and other edge cutting technologies\r\xef\x83\x98\tSecurity and Privacy issues of AI & ML in future smart applications\r\xef\x83\x98\tNovel Designs of AI and ML based systems such as Smart Healthcare, Smart Transportation, Smart Home, Smart Agriculture, Smart Manufacturing, Smart Grid, Smart Education, Smart Government etc.\r\xef\x83\x98\tIntelligent framework for smart future applications : case study\r\xef\x83\x98\tChallenges and Future Research Directions of Smart Applications.\r\xef\x83\x98\tCase studies: Smart Lighting Solutions, Smart Traffic Control Systems etc.\r\xef\x83\x98\tEnvironmentally sustainable and socially resilient cities\r Editors:\r Dr.T.V.Ramana\rProfessor,\rDepartment of CSE, \rJain University, Bangalore, Karnataka, India.\r Dr.G S PRADEEP GHANTASALA\rProfessor,\rDepartment of CSE, \rChitkara University, Punjab, India.\r Dr.R.Sathiyaraj\rAssistant Professor,\rDepartment of CSE, \rSchool of Engineering and Technology, \rCMR University, Bangalore, Karnataka, India.\r Dr. Mudassir Khan\rAssistant Professor,\rDepartment of Computer Science at College of Science & Arts Tanumah, \rKing Khalid University Abha, Saudi Arabia.\r Important Dates:\r 1. Page write-up (Abstract with Title and TOC): 10th July, 2022\r2. Preliminary Acceptance Notification: 25th July, 2022\r3. Full Chapter Submission: 10th October, 2022\r4. Revised Chapter Submission: 10th December, 2022\r5. Acceptance Notification: 30th January, 2022\r  All submissions/queries may be submitted to acaimlsf@gmail.com\r\n'

title: b'RETASTE 2022'
description: b'RETASTE: RETHINK FOOD WASTE Second International Conference'
Categories: b'food waste' b'bio-circular economy' b'waste-to-energy technologies' b'lca in food waste management'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe global food system is the single largest source of greenhouse gasses in the world, and the largest cause of biodiversity loss, terrestrial ecosystem destruction, freshwater consumption, and waterway pollution due to the mismanagement of biocides and nutrients. On top of these deficiencies, approximately 40% of all produced food is wasted throughout the farm to fork continuum, while more than 900 million people remain undernourished.\r It is evident that the margin for optimizing the global food system is huge and may unlock pathways towards the stability of the Earth system and the future of humanity.\r Recognizing these grand food waste challenges, the RETASTE Conference initiates the dialogue for innovative solutions and optimization schemes that take advantage of the significant opportunities for food waste reduction, reuse, and recycling at all levels of the food life cycle, as well as their scalability and commercial translatability. At the same time, RETASTE strives to address social aspects and highlight ways to overcome social and perception barriers against reducing our environmental footprint, thus shifting the evolving future of social, market, and global megatrends.\r Through the effective conservation of natural resources, the strengthening of the social fabric, and the creation of new value chains, RETASTE strives to advance the applicability of Circular Economy concepts.\r Our audience includes academia, industry, and stakeholders, and is truly transdisciplinary as the subject dictates. Join us to Rethink Food Waste!\r THEMES\r \xe2\x80\xa2 Bio-circular economy\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Prevention\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Reduction\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Re-use\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Food for feed\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Source separation schemes\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Collection\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Transportation\r\xe2\x80\xa2 MBT\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Composting\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Anaerobic digestion\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Waste-to-energy technologies\r\xe2\x80\xa2 EU policies\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Socio-economic issues\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Information technology in food waste management\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Food economy and culture\r\xe2\x80\xa2 LCA in food waste management\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Environmental education\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Biorefineries and biotechnology\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Innovation and business interface\r The conference is open in any theme related with food waste management, from farm to fork, and will consider papers related to biowaste.\r \n'

title: b'DCBT 2022'
description: b'Donders Cognition, Brain and Technology Summer School '
Categories: b'brain' b'cognition' b'technology' b'science'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe 14th edition of the Cognition, Brain and Technology Summer School\xe2\x80\x93 DCBT will be hosted by the Donders center of Neuroscienceat at Radboud University in Nijmegen, from September 5 until September 16. This edition is organized in collaboration with several European projects, including the European School of Network Neuroscience  euSNN, iNavigate, NeuroTechEU and the Human Brain Project.\rDCBT is positioned at the interface between biology and future emerging technologies, emphasising the principles underlying brains and their translation to avant-garde technologies. The school has run with great success for the last years thanks to the Convergent Science Network of Biomimetics and Neurotechnology (http://csnetwork.eu/) and to an excellent line-up of outstanding speakers, including Nobel Laureate Edvard Moser and luminaries in the fields of neurosciences, psychology, biology, robotics, and AI, such as Michael Arbib, Stenn Grillner, Giacomo Rizzolatti, among many.\rThe format of the school is a combination of in-depth lectures, student tutorials and projects, road-mapping workshops and discussions. The last day of the school is reserved for the presentation of the students\xe2\x80\x99 projects, to which everybody is invited. \rThis year, the school moved from Barcelona to the beautiful city of Nijmegen, in the Netherlands. The school will be hosted by the Donders Center of Neuroscience at the Radboud University. More specifically, the school will take place at Fletcher Landgoed Hotel Holthurnsche Hof. The program of the school can be found at https://bcbt.specs-lab.com/bcbt22/.\rIn order to get an impression of the school, previous lectures and the school podcast interviews (conducted by Paul Verschure and Tony Prescott) with the school\xe2\x80\x99s speakers are available online at https://www.youtube.com/user/ConvergentScienceNw/playlists and http://csnetwork.eu/talks/podcast\r Please save the date and stay tuned, as more information on registration will follow soon. \rRegistration deadline July 30, 2022\r\n'

title: b'LITERATURE STUDIES  2022'
description: b'XI. International Conference on Literature'
Categories: b'literature' b'art' b'social science' b'POEM'
Call For Papers: b'\nLiterature Studies Conference explores literary works from various rich traditions of Africa, Asia, Europe, and North and South America while examining the literary worlds in terms of their relation to each other, their exchange with society, and the inner tension of past and contemporary. The lives of the authors, literature as a sector, translation issues, readership, and theoretical discussions are the themes also covered by the conference. The conference aims at setting up a comprehensive view of literature standing on a balance of the social and ideological aspects of written works and the detailed in-text analysis. \r Classical works, as well as experimental texts in various genres, constitute a vivid map of world literature. Johann Wolfgang Goethe famously stated early in the 19th century, \xe2\x80\x9cNational literature is now a rather unmeaning term; the epoch of world literature is at hand, and everyone must strive to hasten its approach.\xe2\x80\x9d \r In the era of globalization, the internet, and social media, World Literature has not only been changed in terms of its production, distribution, and consumption, but also generated new ways of writing and historical inquiry. DAKAM\xe2\x80\x99s Literature Conference invites scholars from all over the world to present their contemporary perspectives of literary texts of the past and present echoing the context they\xe2\x80\x99ve been written.\n\t'

title: b'REFUGEES AND FORCED IMMIGRATION  2022'
description: b'VI. International Interdisciplinary Conference on Refugee and Forced Immigration Studies'
Categories: b'refugees' b'war' b'racisim' b'history'
Call For Papers: b'\nWe live in a rapidly changing world in which refugees and forced migration have a significant impact on the economic, political, and social agendas of sovereign states, intergovernmental agencies, and civil society groups.\r Today, tens of millions of people are refugees, raising fundamental challenges for governments around the world. The definition of a refugee, as enshrined in the 1951 Refugee Convention, is someone who \xe2\x80\x98is unable or unwilling to return to their country of origin owing to a well-founded fear of being persecuted for reasons of race, religion, nationality, membership of a particular social group or political opinion.\xe2\x80\x99 But this definition has been regularly challenged over the past 60 years and is under constant review by academics, governments, and humanitarian agencies. Many forcibly displaced people around the world do not easily fit within this formal category.\r The conference takes a critical approach to question normative understandings and addressing empirical puzzles regarding how refugees and international refugee advocacy networks mobilize international and national law and policies to offer new understandings of refugee protection and vulnerabilities. All research seeking to deepen understandings regarding how national institutions define, mediate and respond to refugee legal concerns in crisis will be taken into consideration. In addition to the contemporary refugee crises, historical case studies will be an important part of the event.\r Scholars from different fields such as political science, history, sociology, anthropology, gender studies, urban studies, architecture, literature, poetry, art history, life sciences, and other fields are welcome to propose their interdisciplinary work at the conference. \n\t'

title: b'MEMORY STUDIES  2022'
description: b'VII. International Interdisciplinary Conference\t'
Categories: b'history' b'memory' b'political science' b'film'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe term \xe2\x80\x9cmemory\xe2\x80\x9d is a framework concept that is collecting multidisciplinary academic disciplines beneath. Also, the term \xe2\x80\x9cmemory,\xe2\x80\x9d at the individual level or at the social, or collective level has different connotations due to the interdisciplinary conceptualization of the memory itself. Memory can be seen in psychology, as relating to an individual, his / her ways to remember or forget, and amnesia. Else, memory can be regarded in the collective form and as a collectively shared representation of the past, or it can come up with political terms like national memory, public memory, vernacular memory, or counter-memory.\r \xe2\x80\x8bAdditionally, collective memories can also be regarded as a \xe2\x80\x9cfloating gap\xe2\x80\x9d between memory and history. Therefore, remembering and amnesia play a significant role in defining the positioning of the memory. The \xe2\x80\x9ccultural memory,\xe2\x80\x9d comprises that body of reusable texts, images, and rituals specific to each society in each different time era which can be in the form of the texts, rites, images, monuments, and buildings that are designed to recall fateful events in the history of the collective. They are sanctioned as a common heritage of a society that is accumulated in the Longue Duree. As coined with individual and cultural memory \xe2\x80\x9cthe idea of individual memory,\xe2\x80\x9d as Maurice Halbwachs states, \xe2\x80\x9cabsolutely separate from social memory, is an abstraction almost devoid of the meaning.\xe2\x80\x9d How a nation remembers also defines a branch in memory studies because \xe2\x80\x9cnations can repress with psychological impunity; their collective memories can be changed without a \xe2\x80\x98return of the suppress\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d. Other than individual amnesia, we can speak about a social forgetting which links social, political, and cultural factors at work.\r The interdisciplinary character of the memory links itself to various areas from psychology, sociology, history, identity studies, literary studies, urban history, space history, and media studies to discourse analysis, and other relevant fields linking the subject with the use of memory.\r In 2019, The DAKAM Memory Studies Conference, in its fourth year, aims to provide a platform for discussions and research, which considers various aspects of literature as a memorial medium to contribute to the larger discussion of the ways in which societies and individuals recollect their past and as a field of observation of personal memory to explore and experience the complexities of the mind and emotions.\r Scholars from different fields such as political science, history, sociology, anthropology, gender studies, urban studies, architecture, literature, poetry, art history, life sciences, and other fields are welcome to propose their interdisciplinary work at the conference. \r \xe2\x80\x8b\rwritten by \xc3\x96zge Mumcu\n\t'

Call For Papers: b'\nThe first of the theory of architecture conference series ARCHTHEO has been held in 2011 at Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University, focusing on the possibility of the theory without the backing of the practice or built environment. The title was, therefore, "Theory for the Sake of the Theory" in an emphatic fashion. \r In 2012, the discussion centered on the Living and space, the main has been chosen as "House&Home\' in particular. ARCHTHEO \'13 focused on the two leading roles in architecture, the architect and the so-called \'user\' and  \'Creativity, Autonomy, and Function\' has proved to be fruitful discussion theme. In 2014, \'Architecture and Text\' has been discussed. Last year, \'Architecture and Criticism\' was the main theme. The conferences, which has focus on history rather than theory started even earlier, in 2010. Architecture and Media, Architecture and Art, Interactions in the History, and Architecture, and Politics have the main themes of the events.\n\t'

title: b"GENDER AND WOMEN'S STUDIES  2022"
description: b"VII. International Interdisciplinary Conference on Gender and Women's Studies"
Categories: b'gender' b'women' b'humanities' b'poverty'
Call For Papers: b"\nThe field of gender and women's studies emerged from the contemporary feminist movement with the initial goal of bringing women and their experiences more fully into knowledge. \r How do gender, race, class, sexuality, and age contribute to the formation of social identities? What role do ensuing power differences between these factors play in our globalized and mediatized world? What measures have been taken, in the past and the present, in order to prevent discrimination and exclusion? And how do academic, cultural, artistic, journalistic, and policy-making institutions respond to these societal challenges?\r Emancipation, the recognition of differences, and awareness of intersections of gender with other factors of identity-making (class, race, age, sexuality, etc.) are crucial tools in analyzing social and cultural relations in today\xe2\x80\x99s postcolonial and post-secular societies.\r The conference explores the ways that femininity and masculinity affect an individual\xe2\x80\x99s thought process. This is relevant in a variety of realms, such as social organizations and institutions, interpersonal relationships, and understandings of identity and sexuality.\r Power will also be explored as it relates to gender and other forms of identity, including sexuality, race, class, religion, and nationality as encompasses interdisciplinary fields, which include exploration of the histories and experiences of diverse women and men as well as studies of sexualities, masculinities, femininities, and gender systems in society. The conference will also welcome studies that analyze how gender plays out in politics, intimate life, culture, the workplace, athletics, technology, health, science, and the very production of knowledge itself.\r The relationship between gender and society historically and cross-culturally, the changes now occurring in the roles of women and men, the participation of women in the major institutions of society, and women themselves are among the topics to be included. Historical, contemporary, and transnational analyses of how gender and sexual formations arise in different contexts such as colonialism, nationalism, and globalization can be mentioned as important points of discussion. \n\t"

title: b'CUI  2022'
description: b'X. International Contemporary Urban Issues Conference'
Categories: b'city planning' b'urban life' b'architecture' b'ecology'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe conference aims at fostering discussions of theory and research on urban issues. Focusing on a multidimensional urban phenomenon, this international conference aims to deepen the understanding of informality by opening it to discussion with contributions from various disciplines like architecture, urban planning, sociology, history, economy, and anthropology.\r The emergence of informality as a concept in scholarly discussions can be traced back to the 1970s when \xe2\x80\x9cthe informal sector\xe2\x80\x9d was first used by ILO reports on employment and poverty. The results of the global economic restructuring -such as the flexibilization of production and employment relations, deterioration of collective responsibility, and welfare functions of the state- damage the security of the urban poor in terms of housing and working. Meanwhile, recent socio-economic public policies seem to intensify the condition of informality. Now, it is widely accepted that an informal way of living is a necessity for the urban poor as a survival strategy. Hence, informal work and housing constitute a significant proportion of urban economies and policies.\r What is new in the neo-liberal age is the extending scope of informality. Today, the boundary between the formal and informal is blurred more than before since most urbanites, including the middle classes, experience both formal and informal encounters in their everyday life. Besides, even the urban rich contribute to informality through the development projects on the invaded peripheral land. Consequently, contemporary informality affects not just a marginal segment of the society but a majority of people living in urban spaces.\n\t'

Call For Papers: b'\nCFP: The Routledge History of the Senses\r Co Editors:\r Andrew Kettler, Kenyon College\r William Tullett, Anglia Ruskin University\r Prompt:\r The Routledge History of the Senses, contracted and expected to be in print for 2024, will summarize the existing field of the history of the senses and provide a space for explorations of ongoing research. The history of the senses became prominent within historical study during the 1990s and was methodologically based upon earlier inspirational work that combined anthropological questions of cultural learning with the radical tones of social history. As it has expanded, the field has provided \xe2\x80\x93 and continues to provide \xe2\x80\x93 a considerable space for the exploration of diverse historical topics through the lens of sensory experience and phenomenological interpretation. The central focus of this edited volume is a global history of the senses. As such, this CFP desires a wide range of authors working in Sensory History and Sensory Studies.\r We are specifically looking for authors interested in writing two types of pieces.\r The first group will complete larger historiographical essays of 10,000 words focused on sight, touch, smell, sound, taste, and other sensory worlds. Authors interested in writing one of these six chapters should be able to create a succinct reading of a wide range of interdisciplinary material focused on understanding considerably long historical trajectories of the senses.\r The second group of authors will complete shorter essays that offer brief historiographical entries and an opportunity to promote their own research. Each of these smaller, 6,000 word, essays includes a topic of the author\xe2\x80\x99s choosing after consultation with the editors, and a brief historiographical background for that topic.\r Examples include focused subjects underneath the guiding sections of: Gender, Sexuality, and the Senses; Religion, Faith, Spiritualism; Race, Racism, Ethnicity, and the Senses; Class, Social Spaces, and the Senses; Governance, Law, Power, and the Senses; Remembrance, Reclamation, Re-enactment and Reconstruction; Science, Medicine, and the Senses; Media, Technology, and the Senses; Emotions and the Senses; Military and Diplomacy. As a global history we are seeking authors from a wide range of regions who can provide historical case studies that also illustrate historiographies of Sensory Studies.\r If you are interested in contributing to this volume, please e-mail smellhistory@gmail.com. The deadline for initial e-mails of interest, including a CV and a short statement concerning the type of article and the specific sensory history you are interested in working with, is July 1 of 2022. Please place a subject heading of \xe2\x80\x9cRoutledge History of the Senses\xe2\x80\x9d for that e-mail. After confirmation of topics and e-mail consultation on the focus of the essays, initial drafts will be due January 1 of 2023.\r Contact Info: \rsmellhistory@gmail.com\n\t'

title: b'94th  IAEC 2022'
description: b'94th International Atlantic Economic Conference'
Categories: b'economics' b'finance'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe 94th International Atlantic Economic Conference will be held in person 6- 9 October 2022, in Washington, DC. Submission fees will be waived for all PhD students upon receipt of proof of student status (photo of your student ID sent to iaes@iaes.org). Ph.D. students will still be responsible for paying the student registration fee if their abstract is accepted for presentation.\r The mission of the conference is to create a platform where economists and finance experts from academe, government, and the private sector can present their research results, exchange ideas and network in a collegial environment. Meetings also provide opportunities for participants to renew acquaintances and to forge new ones. Distinguished delegates from around the world gather to present, discuss, and exchange valuable information in the fields of economics, business, and finance. Participants share drafts of their research with their session colleagues 30 days in advance of the meeting to facilitate dialogue at the conference. We invite you to take part in this opportunity to gain international insight and perspective. The conference also helps attendees stay up to date on research associated with their fields. We look forward to seeing you at the conference!\n\t'

title: b'RECI 2022'
description: b'The Second International Workshop on Reliability Engineering and Computational Intelligence'
Categories: b'reliability engineering' b'artificial intelligence' b'data mining' b'risk analysis'
Call For Papers: b'\nExcellent papers for the 1st RECI workshop in the year 2020 demonstrated strong synergy between Reliability Engineering and Computational Intelligence but scientific differences remain. The 2nd RECI workshop attempts to address further integration by\ra) presenting papers on RECI topics,\rb) panel discussions about future RECI research and\rc) a curriculum discussion for an international RECI curriculum. \r The workshop is organized by University of \xc5\xbdilina, TNO, Delft University of Technology, and the University of Huddersfield and will be supported by the projects:\r* Advanced Centre for PhD students and young researchers in informatics (ACeSYRI) (https://acesyri.eu/)\r* New methods development for reliability analysis of complex system (APVV-18-0027 of the Slovak Research and Development Agency)\r* Safety Enterprise Architecture, TNO project 060.51672/01.03: Occupational Safety Innovation/Huddersfield\r Participation:\rThe workshop RECI 2022 will be a hybrid event: we facilitate contributions in-person and online from Delft University of Technology. The organizers believe that the 200 Euro fee for in-person should not be prohibitive for in-person participation On-line participation will be free of charge. TUDelft hosts the event at the event location \xe2\x80\x98X\xe2\x80\x99 on Mekelweg 8, 2628 CD, Delft, THE NETHERLANDS.\r Publication:\rThe workshop presentations will not be published as papers. The abstracts of presentation will be accepted at the workshop web-page. Authors of all presentation will be invited to publish papers in the journal CERES (http://ceres-journal.eu). Authors of selected presentations will be invited to prepare the contributions for the book \xe2\x80\x9cReliability Engineering and Computational Intelligence\xe2\x80\x9d which will be published by Springer in series of Studies in Computational Intelligent. \r Topics:\rThe workshop develops RECI as a research domain by calling papers on current research. Examples include, but are not limited to: \r* Mathematical & computational methods for risk analysis\r* Computational intelligence for risk estimation\r* Digital technologies for reliability engineering\r* Software solutions for testing fault-tolerant systems\r* Data mining and Knowledge discovery\r* Methods based on Artificial Intelligence\r* Accident and incident investigation\r* Human reliability analysis\r* Risk and hazard analysis\r* Software reliability\r* Hardware and software solutions\r* Education, e-learning\r* Trends in RECI\r Important dates:\rAbstract submission \t                13 October 2022\rPresentation of accepted abstracts  14-15 November 2022\rFull paper submission\t                25 October 2022\rNotification of acceptance\t        10 January 2023\rCamera ready format submission\t        25 January 2023\r Submission of contributions:\rThe presentation title, authors, their affiliations and abstract of 1,000 symbols should be submitted to the submission system https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=reci2022.\r WE ARE LOOKING FORWARD TO YOUR EXCELLENT CONTRIBUTIONS!\r  Contacts:\rDepartment of Informatics\rUniversity of Zilina\rUniverzitna 1, 01026, Zilina, Slovakia\rpatrik.rusnak@fri.uniza.sk\r University of Huddersfield & TNO Healthy Living\rQueensgate DH13DH, Huddersfield, UK\rc.vangulijk@hud.ac.uk\n\t'

title: b'FSP 2022'
description: b'2022 International Workshops on Future Security and Privacy'
Categories: b'security' b'privacy'
Call For Papers: b'\n* Workshop Overview\r The 2022 International Workshop on Future Security and Privacy (FSP 2022) will be held in Jeju, as one of registered workshops of PlatCon-22, 22-24 August 2022. Every time every where, we need security and privacy protection for our every systems and even for our daily lives. Future Computing Technologies would promise more convenient digital lives to us, but also they would introduce more complicated and various risks to us. So we need to foresee future security and privacy needs in advance. FSP 2022 will be a very good chance and forum for many security peoples to get together. We can share our knowledge and know-how, and we can see more detailed the-state-of-art technologies for security and privacy on future IT technologies or systems.\r  * Topics\r Potential authors are invited to submit original, unpublished research articles, and on-going research papers, and also some invited articles, in all areas related to the platform technologies including, but not limited to, the following suggested topics:\r - Authorization, identification & authentication\r- Bigdata security\r- Biometric authentication\r- Energy and smart grid securities\r- Cloud security\r- Cryptography and Cryptanalysis\r- Digital forensics\r- Hardware, application, and system security\r- Information assurance and trustworthy\r- Intrusion detection, traffic analysis and decision making of security\r- IT Convergence security\r- Mobile security\r- Network security and malware\r- Privacy in pervasive sensing\r- Privacy in social media\r- Security and privacy policies\r- Security architectures, policies, and regulations\r- Security coding and engineering\r- Security modeling and vulnerability analysis\r- Usable security\r- Web security\r- AI security\r  * Paper Submission\r Authors should submit their 4-6 page full papers to the following EDAS system for review: https://edas.info/N29578 \r Please make sure that you MUST select "Workshop : FSP 2022" Track\r You can download a sample format here:  https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html\r  * Contacts\r If you have enquiries about the FSP 2022, please contact Changhoon Lee. cryptography1@gmail.com\n\t'

title: b'WAIS - SINGAPORE 2022'
description: b'World AI Show RPA & ML - SINGAPORE'
Categories: b'conference' b'physical event' b'artificial intelligence' b'robotics'
Call For Papers: b"\nAI Roadmap to Scale Adoption and Create Value with Innovation \r Addressing sector-wide issues with innovative AI solutions to create transformative disruptions in sectors of strategic relevance to Singapore. \r   What is World AI & RPA Show? \r World AI & RPA Show is a thought-leadership-driven, business-focused, global series of events that takes place in strategic locations across the world. \r As part of the world tour, the Singapore edition is gathering pre-qualified CIOs, CEOs, CTOs, Heads of AI, Chief Digital Officers, Heads of Innovation and International AI experts from the industry. \r The show features exciting keynotes, enterprise use-case presentations, product showcase, panel discussions and tech talks to discuss the latest challenges for the sector arising out of the pandemic situation. Witness next-gen AI solutions from global leaders and explore its relevance and impact on your organisation. \r   Why Singapore? \r AI has the potential to reinvigorate the state-island\xe2\x80\x99s economy and boost its industrial profits. \r According to the recent report by Accenture, AI could add up to US$ 215 bn in gross value across 11 industries by 2035. \r   Singapore Government's Initiatives \r The government recently announced its partnership with the World Economic Forum\xe2\x80\x99s Centre for Fourth Industrial Revolution (WEF C4IR) to help drive ethical and responsible deployment of AI technologies. \r The framework provides guidance which is both detailed and readily implementable to help organisations navigate the complex ethical questions that often arise when AI technologies and solutions are deployed. \r   Rising Opportunities \r The rapid growth of AI presents an opportunity to provide solutions to some of its most pressing problems, such as food security, healthcare and financial services that will lead to eventual economic growth and inclusive development. \r  FOR FREE PASS REGISTRATION VISIT: https://bit.ly/3mMllOk\n\t"

Call For Papers: b'\nInternational Journal of Managing Value and Supply Chains (IJMVSC)Citations, h-index, i10-index of IJMVSC Citations\t2296\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0h-index\t24\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0i10-index\t50\tScope & TopicsThe International Journal of Managing Value and Supply Chains ( IJMVSC) is a quarterly open access peer-reviewed journal that publishes articles that contribute new results in all areas of value and supply chain management. The journal provides a platform to disseminate new ideas and new research, advance theories, and propagate best practices in the management of value and supply chain management, looking across both product and service-based businesses. This will include works based in service management, logistics and distribution, operations management, process management, flow control, and customer service. The journal offers a forum in which academics, consultants, and practitioners in a variety of fields can exchange ideas to further research and improve practices in all areas of business. The International Journal of Managing Value and Supply Chains ( IJMVSC ) seek to establish new collaborations, new best practices, and new theories in the management of both product and service-based organizations around the world. Authors are solicited to contribute to the journal by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the areas of value and supply chain management.Topics of interest include but are not limited to, the following     Supply chain management Value chain management Analytical frameworks Business-to-business marketing Change management Channel management Cultural issues Customer service Customer retention strategies Demand forecasting and planning Distribution channels Economic issues Information technology in product distribution Information technology in service delivery Knowledge management  Legal and regulatory issues Logistics management and planning (inbound, outbound and reverse logistics) Manufacturing methods and strategies Metrics and Measurement Network design and routing Quality control and improvement Performance metrics Purchasing and procurement e-procurement and e-commerce Product innovation and development Sourcing strategies Supplier selection Vendor management and selection    Paper SubmissionAuthors are invited to submit papers for this journal through E-mail\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0ijmvsc@aircconline.com. title: b'MoMM 2022'
description: b'The 20th International Conference on Advances in Mobile Computing and Multimedia Intelligence'
Categories: b'mobile computing' b'multimedia intelligence' b'cloud and edge computing' b'artificial intelligent systems'
Call For Papers: b'\nC A L L    F O R    P A P E R S\r The 20th International Conference on Advances in Mobile Computing and Multimedia Intelligence (MoMM2022)\r                          28-30 November, 2022 - Bari, Italy \r                      http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/momm2022/                 \r                              email: momm2022@iiwas.org\r      Paper submission: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=momm2022\r "Designing and Developing Intelligent Mobile and Ubiquitous Solutions for Social Good"\r  )) For those who will not be able to attend in person, online participation will be made available ((\r  *** Important Dates ***\r15 July 2022 (SHARP): Submission due, Full Papers (12 pages), Short papers, demos & work in progress (6 pages)\r15 August 2022: Acceptance Notifications\r1 September 2022: Camera-Ready Papers and Authors Registration\r28 - 30 November 2022: Conference Dates\r *** Publication ***\rALL accepted MoMM2022 papers will be published by Springer in their Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS). LNCS volumes are indexed in the Conference Proceedings Citation Index (CPCI), part of Clarivate Analytics\xe2\x80\x99 Web of Science; Scopus; EI Engineering Index; Google Scholar; DBLP; etc. Selected high-quality papers will be invited to be published, after revision and extension, in special issues of international journals.\r *** Scope ***\rDuring the last decade, mobile computing and multimedia have gone through massive advancements in terms of both hardware innovations and software solutions. The emerging and exponential technologies have accelerated research across a wide array of topics such as smart cities, digital twins, nanotechnology, augmented and virtual reality, artificial intelligence, chatbots and conversational interfaces, edge computing and server-less cloud computing. While the new technologies and developments have the potential to affect our lives and create positive social impact, they introduce huge challenges in terms of the design, underlying algorithms, implementation and technology adoption. MoMM provides an opportunity for researchers to present, share and discuss their research results and experiences with other researchers and experts in the same or similar fields.\r Prior to 2020, MoMM has been held in Munich (2019), Yogyakarta (2018), Salzburg (2017), Singapore (2016), Brussels (2015), Kaohsiung (2014), Vienna (2013), Bali (2012), Ho Chi Minh City (2011), Paris (2010), Kuala Lumpur (2009), and Linz (2008). Last years, MoMM2020 and MoMM2021 conferences were held as virtual conference. This year, MoMM2022 will be held in person in Italy.\r *** Submission ***\rMoMM accepted four different types of contributions:\r- Original theoretical work: The contributions are expected to show original work that provide foundations to further progress research in the area. Rigorous proofs and/or performance measurements are expected for this type of contribution.\r- Real world case study: The contributions are expected to show a real world case study of an adopted concept and technology. The analysis of the case study should provide an original insight and findings, backing up by data collected from experiments and/or observation.\r- Experimental work: The contributions are expected to show reporting of rigorous comparative experiments of existing algorithms/systems to provide insight to the current state of the art in a research domain.\r- Lessons learnt reports:  The contributions are expected to show lessons learnt from adoption of complex technology integration or implementation. \r *** Topics ***\rSpecific topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r- Multimedia Intelligence\r- Artificial Intelligent Systems applications in Computers and Communications\r- Mobile and ubiquitous multimedia\r- Internet of Things solutions and applications\r- Smart cities\r- Mobile sensing technologies and applications\r- Mobile healthcare applications\r- Wearable computing  \r- Mobile crowd sensing\r- Mobile multimodal interfaces\r- Chatbots and conversational interfaces\r- Cloud and edge computing\r- Immersive computing\r- Context-aware applications and recommender systems\r- Data Visualisation on mobile devices\r- Localisation, positioning and tracking systems\r- Mobile distributed reasoning and processing \r- Spatial searching and routing\r- Multi-agent systems \r *** Submission Guidelines ***\rPapers and demonstration descriptions must be submitted electronically in PDF through EasyChair. Submitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal, conference, or workshop with proceedings. Submitted demonstrations should convey a scientific result and should not be advertisements for commercial software packages. Submitted papers and demonstrations will be subject to stringent peer review by at least three members of the international program committee and carefully evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity of exposition. Accepted papers and demonstration descriptions will appear in the conference proceedings to be published by Springer LNCS. \rFormat requirements for submissions of papers and demonstrations are:\r- Maximum 12 pages, including the abstract (no more than 150 words), all figures and references for Full Technical papers.\r- Maximum 6 pages, including the abstract (no more than 150 words), all figures and references for Short Position Papers.\r- A video clip (for review purpose only) and a description of maximum 4 pages for the demonstration. The description should outline the underlying novel concepts, methods and/or approaches, and details about implementation, deployment, testing, and evaluation and user uptake.\r- All submissions should be formatted according to the Springer LNCS guidelines (https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines)\r- Submissions must be entered into the Submission System (https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=momm2022)\r *** Awards ***\rMoMM2022 best paper awards, best student paper awards, and best demonstrations will be selected based on novelty, significance, and the presentation at the conference. Best student paper awards can only be awarded to papers on which students are first authors.\r *** Past Conferences ***\rhttp://www.iiwas.org/conferences.htm\rACM Digital library: https://dl.acm.org/conference/momm\rDBLP: http://www.informatik.uni-trier.de/~ley/db/conf/momm/\r *** Program Committees ***\rPari Delir Haghighi, Program Committee Chair, Monash University, Australia (pari.delir.haghighi@monash.edu)\r For more questions regarding submission and conference organisation please contact momm2022@iiwas.org\n\t'

Call For Papers: b'\n C A L L     F O R     P A P E R S\r The 24th International Conference on Information Integration and Web Intelligence (iiWAS2022)\r                             28-30 November 2022, Bari, Italy\r                      http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2022/\r                             email: iiwas2022@iiwas.org\r         Paper submission: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=iiwas2022\r  "Collecting, Processing, Analysing and Storing Data/Information to Support Human Intelligence"\r  )) For those who will not be able to attend in person, online participation will be made available ((\r  *** Important Dates ***\r15 July 2022 (SHARP): Submission due; full Papers (12 pages), Short papers, demos & work in progress (6 pages)\r15 August 2022: Acceptance Notifications\r1 September 2022: Camera-Ready Papers and Authors Registration\r28 - 30 November 2022: Conference Dates\r *** Publication ***\rALL accepted iiWAS2022 papers will be published by Springer in their Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS). LNCS volumes are indexed in the Conference Proceedings Citation Index (CPCI), part of Clarivate Analytics\xe2\x80\x99 Web of Science; Scopus; EI Engineering Index; Google Scholar; DBLP; etc. Selected high-quality papers will be invited to be published, after revision and extension, in special issues of international journals.\r *** Scope ***\rData and information are crucial in providing evidence based decision making in many aspect of human activities, as an individual or as a group. The way information and communication technology are used to collect, process, analysis and store data has always evolves. New techniques are invented, existing techniques are improved and old techniques are integrated to the new. Each of these provided some challenges and opportunities to our research community in finding the best way to meet these challenges. iiWAS provides research community with the opportunity to share and discuss their ideas. \rPrior to 2020, iiWAS has been held in Munich (2019), Yogyakarta (2018), Salzburg (2017), Singapore (2016), Brussels (2015), Hanoi (2014), Vienna (2013), Bali (2012), Ho Chi Minh City (2011), Paris (2010), Kuala Lumpur (2009), and Linz (2008). Last years, iiWAS2020 and iiWAS2021 conferences were held as virtual conference. This year, iiWAS2022 will be held in person in Italy.\r *** Submissions ***\riiWAS accepted four different types of contributions:\r- Original theoretical work:  The contributions are expected to show original work that provide foundations to further progress research in the area. Rigorous proofs and/or performance measurements are expected for this type of contribution.\r- Real life case study:  The contributions are expected to show a real life case study of an adopted concept and technology. The analysis of the case study should provide an original insight and findings, backing up by data collected from experiments and/or observation.\r- Experimental work:  The contributions are expected to show reporting of rigorous comparative experiments of existing algorithms/systems to provide insight to the current state of the art in a research domain.\r- Lessons learnt reports: The contributions are expected to show lessons learnt from adoption of complex technology integration or implementation.\r *** Topics ***\rSpecific topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r- Web Intelligence\r- Data science and Data engineering\r- Cloud and Edge Computing\r- Trusted, Responsible and Interpretable AI\r- Big data & Data Analytics\r- Cloud data management\r- NoSQL databases\r- Crowdsourcing\r- Social networks analysis\r- Sensors data management\r- Data Mining\r- Semantic Web and Ontology\r- Search and Information Technology\r- Query Language and Processing\r- Advanced web technology and application\r- Spatial data storage, query and processing\r- Health informatics\r- Education informatics\r- Data Integration, Metadata Management, and Interoperability\r- Distributed, parallel and cloud databases\r- Social media analytics and processing\r- Data modelling and analysis\r- Big data processing\r- Web content analysis, semantic and knowledge\r- Data systems integration\r- Data connectivity in internet of things\r- Blockchain Technologies\r- Linked Open Data\r- Deep/Hidden Web\r *** Submission Guidelines ***\rPapers must be submitted electronically in PDF through EasyChair. Submitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal or a conference with proceedings. \rSubmitted papers will be subject to stringent peer review by at least three members of the international program committee and carefully evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity of exposition. Accepted papers will appear in the conference proceedings to be published by Springer.\rFormat requirements for submissions of papers are:\r- Maximum 12 pages, including the abstract (no more than 150 words), all figures and references for Full Technical papers.\r- Maximum 6 pages, including the abstract (no more than 150 words), all figures and references for Short Position Papers.\r- All submissions should be formatted according to the Springer LNCS guidelines (https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines)\r- Submissions must be entered into the Submission System (https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=iiwas2022)\r *** Awards ***\riiWAS2022 best paper awards and student paper awards will be conferred on the authors at the conference.\r *** Past Conferences ***\rhttp://www.iiwas.org/conferences.htm \rACM Digital library: https://dl.acm.org/conference/iiwas \rDBLP: http://www.informatik.uni-trier.de/~ley/db/conf/iiwas/\r *** Program Committee co-Chairs ***\r- Maria Indrawan-Santiago, Program Committee Chair, @WAS Organization (maria@iiwas.org)\r- Eric Pardede, Program Committee CoChair, La Trobe University, Australia (E.Pardede@latrobe.edu.au)\r For more inquiries about the submission and conference organisation please contact iiwas2022@iiwas.org\n\t'
